	<item>
		<title>01</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/growteam/lorem-ipsum-dolor-sit-aset-amet-7/01-2/</link>

-Should be good in Relational Databases and SQLs.
-Experience working on browser-independent designs and cross-browser issues
-Should be a good team player and able to accept challenges.
-Should have good communication skills. (Needs to communicate via Emails regularly)]]></content:encoded>

		<title>PHP/Angular JS Developer</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/careers/phpangular-js-developer/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 22 Dec 2016 11:03:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/?post_type=careers&#038;p=189</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Looking for a PHP/Angular JS Developer with minimum 1 year experience who will be a part of a creative team that is responsible for all aspects of the ongoing development. He/She will be working on PHP, Frameworks &amp; CMS and will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your co-workers into the application.

<strong>Responsibilities</strong>

1. Full stack software development in PHP with JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, HTML5/CSS3

2. Must have experience with AngularJS

3. Must have experience on MVC Frameworks like Zend, Yii, LARAVEL with practical exposure

4. Database - MySQL/ MongoDB

5. Knowledge of version control: Git/SVN

6. Should have knowledge of implementation of API's

7. Proficiency in design patterns

8. Experience in Product development is added advantage

]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Preparations day @ ICT expo Hong Kong Convention &amp; Exhibition Centre</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/2012-preparation-day-for-the-ict-expo/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 17 Jul 2012 02:47:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=42</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[12th of April, 2012 preparation day for the ICT Expo starting from 13th April till 16th. We landed in Hong Kong at 8 Am local time. Straight to work. The team got into the action to get to Hong Kong convention centre at Wan Chai. Unpacking the printing material is a harder job than Zend &amp; Yii framework development for sure. Its an Art and we somehow managed to get the TII logos and promotional material in place. A glimpse of our Stand and our founder Ami Verma at preparation day.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>279</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>The Magical Effect Of Responsive Web Design</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/the-magical-effect-of-responsive-web-design/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 16 Aug 2012 05:25:54 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=401</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: justify;">Gone are the days when the good old desktop was the sole medium of Internet browsing. With the ever changing technological landscape, we now see a host of Internet access mediums around us in the form of smartphones, net-books, ultra-books, e-readers and tablets. This has also generated the necessity to allow device-independent and resolution-independent web design that looks and feel the same across all these devices.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">For example, your smartphone may offer a screen resolution of 960 x 640 pixels; this changes dramatically to around 1366 x 768 pixels for a desktop PC. Well, thanks to the new age <strong>Responsive Web Design (RWD)</strong> technology, web pages are now designed to acclimatize according to the outline of the viewing environment and are no longer limited by browser or machine.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">In responsive web design, the grids used are based on fluid proportion technology. As a result, the grids use ems/percentages instead of pixels. So, when the grids no more depend upon the number of pixels, it eventually allow them to stretch and squeeze according to the screen size. In simple words, it adds flexibility to the web layout. What this means for you is that your site now has a much wider target audience reach translating to increased prospects.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">To make a site responsive, it has to fulfill three pre-requisites:
1. A <strong>flexible (or fluid) grid</strong> of web elements (use of Marcotte Calculator is a popular method): Here the size of web element and the container size determines the layut it terms of number in ems that can be programmed to give flexibility of viewing across different media.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">2. Use of <strong>media queries</strong>: This is W3Cs answer to the challenge of showing images consistent with the web browser. They allow web designers to program target styles based on different device properties such as orientation, resolution, screen size etc</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">3. Use of <strong>fluid images</strong>: Use of programming to restrict the image size to be less than that of the container is what fluid images denotes in the simplest terms. So irrespective of how small or big the container becomes, the image within it resizes itself proportionately to fit the container.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">The impact that responsive web design has had on web design can be gauged from its popularity. In fact it was recognized as the #2 top design trends of 2012 (source - .net Magazine  Jan 2012).</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>401</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>

	<item>
		<title>The Truth about HTML5 for Website Development</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/the-truth-about-html5-for-website-development/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 22 Oct 2012 07:55:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=524</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Getting down to designing and developing fully functional websites for the Internet can be very hard. Website designers and developers encounter plenty of alternatives from which the best needs to be chosen  which frameworks, libraries and technologies, should we use? Most of all is the query of cross browser compatibility that comes with rapidly advancing technologies enabling viewing web pages on desktops, laptops, smartphones and tablets.

One perfect way to support multiple devices and browsers is to write HTML 5 code and use custom CSS class. Much of HTML 5 features draw JavaScript APIs which make it comfortable to design interactive website but therere a slew of new features that enable additional semantics in your traditional Web 1.0 pages.

HTML 5 features are different from HTML 4. HTML 4 may not provide exact info as the specifications are in development. However in light of rapidly evolving web development technologies, you need to be wary, and keep a tab on the upcoming updates or changes in HTML5, use it in a majority of circumstances. Of course, did you know that doctype honestly is not even certainly required for HTML5? Nevertheless, its used for older and current browsers and devices that necessity a specified HTML5 doctype. Browsers that dont know understand this HTML5 doctype will easily render the contained design in standards mode.

For web developers assistance about the status of the specification of HTML5, the WWW Consortium (W3C) has released a tentative scheme outlining a 2014 deadline for finishing of the new technology as a standard; 8 years ahead of past schedules. HTML 5 is still in progress, with Working Draft feature. But the latest "Scheme" published by the WWW Consortium outlines several milestones the faction will have to meet in order to publish the final HTML 5.0 version by the end of 2014.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Need more space on Boot partition for kernel upgrade in centos 6?</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/need-more-space-on-boot-partition-for-kernel-upgrade-in-centos-6/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 23 Nov 2012 06:10:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=596</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Hi,

While updating the newly install server CentOS 6.3, got an error need 27MB more space on boot partition (which is 100 MB) in size. So struck there. Got a solution ?

Well, here it is:

1. See which is the current kernel being used:

<strong>uname -r</strong>

output is:

2.6.32-279.2.1.el6.i686

<strong></strong>2. Note the name of kernel in output and see all the available kernels on the partition:

<strong>rpm -qa | grep kernel</strong>

<strong></strong>3. Removeunnecessarykernels:

rpm -e kernel-firmware-2.6.32-279.2.6.32-279.2.1.el6.noarch

4. Install the new kernel by yum update]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Importance of Google Page Rank after Penguin and Panda:</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/importance-of-google-page-rank-after-penguin-and-panda/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 27 Nov 2012 04:57:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=604</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Oi Amiga! (Hello Friends)

These days on internet you can find numerous debates running on the importance of Page rank now and before panda-penguin updates. Somehow I have managed sometime to add my little experience into this debate.

Before proceeding about our main topic I would like to add some words about Page Rank:<!--more-->

<span style="color: #3366ff"><strong>What is Page Rank?</strong></span>
<ul>
	<li>Page rank in general is importance of a particular page in Googles eyes.</li>
	<li>Google calculates it with an algorithm created by Larry page and Sergey brin.</li>
	<li>Page rank is one of those 200 factors that Google uses to rank a website in Search engines.</li>
</ul>
<span style="color: #3366ff"><strong>How Google calculates Page Rank:</strong></span>
<ul>
	<li>It depends on the Number of quality inbound links.</li>
	<li>It also depends upon the number of outgoing links on that page</li>
</ul>
Page Rank tends to flow from one page to another web-page which is linked to it, just like blood flows from one vein to another inter connected vein. But links having no-follow attributes do not pass on page rank to other web pages.

<span style="color: #3366ff"><strong>So site having higher number of inbound links should have High PR?</strong></span>

No, like I said PR is ratio of quality inbound links to outbound links on that page so outbound links should be under control as to achieve high page rank.

<span style="color: #3366ff"><strong>Does that mean site having good PR will rank higher in SERPs?</strong></span>

No as I said it is one of those 200 factors that Google count to rank a website on particular keyword.

<span style="color: #3366ff"><strong>When Google Updates Page Rank?</strong></span>

Earlier page rank of a website/webpage tends to update after 3 months but in these 2 years I have seen Google is giving page rank to the websites or updating it before 3 months sometimes its like within a month or so.

<span style="color: #3366ff"><strong>Who need to care about PR?</strong></span>

If you are into advertising and selling space of your website for do-follow paid link/ads(which indeed is not a good strategy at all) then you must take good care of your websites PR because other webmaster take PR into consideration before applying for ads on your website.

<span style="color: #3366ff"><strong>Who shouldnt bother about gaining PR through his extra efforts?</strong></span>

If your content is impeccable, visitors having genuine interest in your website and sharing your website content automatically then you need not to worry about your website PR as other people are doing this for you. They are sharing it onto different places the only thing that you need to take care of your website is its content only.

<span style="color: #3366ff"><strong>Conclusion:</strong></span>

PR still has its importance but dont get lost into it, you must take care of your websites content and user engagement, PR and SEO is second part. If you are doing SEO only and your website visitor is not spending good time on your website then this PR will be of no use. I have seen websites having good page rank still hit by Google Penguin just because they were not taking into account the value to the users through their websites. General users dont know what is PR and he will never check the green line appearing in the toolbars.]]></content:encoded>

With 120 participating IT companies from across the globe, this is an apt forum for leaders such as Techies India Inc. to highlight their innovative IT solutions delivery and core competencies of their skilled professionals.<!--more-->

	<item>
		<title>Local Internet Marketing Goes Mainstream</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/local-internet-marketing-goes-mainstream/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 21 Mar 2013 06:24:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=658</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[With the advent of the Internet, the marketing efforts of numerous SME organizations have taken a completely different route. Internet has now become the biggest platform of marketing. SEO, use of keywords in content, mailers and Google updates has become a major part of the marketing efforts of all organizations who wish to sustain in this age of competition.<!--more-->

Never have companies had access to the wide array of online marketing tools available today. It is now a standard marketing function to understand the basics of local search results to get in touch with the needs of their customers. However, localizing your product and service offerings is often overlooked. Imagine a person living in London querying a list of multi cuisines restaurants. Will he type in multi cuisines restaurants or multi cuisines restaurants in London? The answer explains the critical business differentiator that local internet marketing provides.

To reap rich benefits from local internet marketing, follow these simple steps:-
<ol>
	<li>Knowing what segment of the market or geography you will target is the first step to getting your local marketing efforts underway. If you are a hair stylist from Yorkshire, you would want your prospective customers to come from areas in and around Yorkshire. Obviously customers from farther places will not travel all the way for your services, right?</li>
	<li>Keep a list of keywords that you target audience would key in to search for your product or service. If you own a day care nursery in Essex, what query would you expect your target audience (parents of toddlers) to key in? Nursery? Kindergarten? Child tuitions? Preschools? Think about it and then use the correct keywords in your content. A major portion of a companys success in marketing and advertising efforts is determined by appropriate content.</li>
	<li>Leverage your knowledge of page 1 search engine results for your business keywords to determine a strategy that will help push your website to the top. Analyze your competitors webpages and see what content brings their site to the forefront. Always keep a tab on what Google likes and doesnt like, and design your website with this information in mind.</li>
</ol>
Companies such as Techies India Inc. will help you formulate an appropriate local marketing strategies to keep your business ahead of the competition and realize positive growth. With the ever-changing algorithms that drive search engines, the different Internet marketing approaches too need to evolve to keep pace so that they use these approaches to their advantage. Getting your local Internet marketing nuances right is a significant step in this direction. Overall, local online marketing seem to be the prevalent and winning theme of a small or medium sized companys marketing efforts and you could do well to capitalize on it.]]></content:encoded>

Our unique position as an emerging high performance player in the sphere of web and mobile app development is sure to grab eyeballs, even as almost 600 IT and Telecom companies showcase their services.<!--more-->

		<title>Zend Framework1 vs Zend Framework2</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/zend-framework1-vs-zend-framework2/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 02 Apr 2013 07:22:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=665</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<style type="text/css"><!--
@page { margin: 2cm }
		P { margin-bottom: 0.21cm }
--></style><span style="font-size: small;">A brief comparison between zend framework 1 and zend framework 2:- </span>
<img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-666" alt="zend1vszend2" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/zend1vszend2.jpg" width="650" height="800" />
<span style="font-size: small;">In conclusion we would say ZF2 is in beta and you are using a standard skeleton without any optimization like caching and class map auto loading. So you can either choose to go for a new architecture altogether, keep it with the trends and update yourself by using ZF2 or remain traditional sticking on to <a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/zend-framework-development">Zend Framework</a> older version i.e ZF1.</span>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Magento? OpenCart? Which one is it then?</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/magento-opencart-which-one-is-it-then/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 20 Feb 2013 09:47:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=635</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Getting down to developing an eCommerce site involves the critical decision of choosing the right eCommerce application. Magento and OpenCart are two such open source eCommerce systems. While both are extensively used by e-retailers of all types, from smaller establishments to multinational conglomerates, a Magento Development Company will often be faced with a situation that needs them to choose one over the other.<!--more-->

<img class="aligncenter" alt="Magento Vs Opencart" src="http://www.miraclestudios.in/blog/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/magento-vs-opencart.png" />
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
Just one step before comparing the two shopping cart development solutions, lets see what they have in common. This will help a <a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/magento-development">Magento Development Company</a> choose the apt platform for shopping cart development.

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>1.</strong> Both are open source platforms that are backed by solid online support community
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>2.</strong> Both offer guest checkout that allows people to purchase products without having an account
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>3.</strong> Both offer catalogued and indexed list of products on display and can handle any number of product categories
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>4.</strong> Both are designed to absorb high overload in terms of number of hits on websites

When getting down to comparing the two, we see Magento winning hands down due to the following benefits that it offers (yeah, good news for a Magento Development Company!)

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>1.</strong> Customization options in Magento far outweigh those that are provided by OpenCart. This permits a far greater degree of personalization of website than possible with OpenCart
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>2.</strong> In terms of sheer number of extensions available, Magento leads the race with a wider array of addons that can be easily customized in the shopping cart development stage
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>3.</strong> Magento has very good built-in SEO features and scores way over OpenCarts SEO tools
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>4.</strong> In Magento, you have the option of using a single administrative module to control and update numerous eCommerce stores. Thus it works very well for giant e-retailers that have huge eCommerce stores running online
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong> 5.</strong> While both offer reporting facilities, the extensive reporting offered by Magento (sales, inventory and dashboards) again puts it ahead of OpenCart

To conclude, both Magento and Open Cart come with their own positive and not-so-positive points. As a Magento Development Company we suggest that a customer and developer must know what features and what level of user-friendliness should the site provide before making the choice.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Content Marketing - The All-In-One Proposition For Your Business</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/?p=2131</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 28 Jan 2015 06:41:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2131</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Content Marketing is a vital element of a business marketing mix today. Content that is targeted, relevant and timely can help create a rewarding association with readers. It not only attracts readers attention, but also helps businesses to nurture a relationship with them. This ultimately culminates to sales and new customers.

As a function, content marketing has evolved tremendously over the past few years. With the remarkable reach and coverage of Internet, it is a smart move to embrace content marketing to utilize the influence of the Internet to your benefit. And this can be done effectively through content marketing.
<h3><strong>Why content marketing for sales?</strong></h3>
Simply put, content marketing is the strategic process of creating and distributing high value content to address of answer specific needs/ queries of the readers. It comprises of two main segments  <em>creating content</em> and <em>distributing content</em>. Be it any phase of the sales funnel  right from prospecting to closing  we have experienced that content marketing plays a vital role in each step of the way. It helps to attract visitors to your business site, keeps them engaged and eventually acquire the customer who consumes the content.
<h3><strong>How does it boost sales?</strong></h3>
<ol>
	<li><strong>Connect with readers and their needs</strong>  Content marketing helps acquire trust with readers by sharing information that will be of help to them. Imagine a salesman coming every day to ask you to purchase a product that may or may not have a need for. This is precisely what traditional marketing does  their in-the-face, blatant selling techniques actually repel most of the customers rather than drawing them in.</li>
</ol>
<ul>
	<li>On the other hand,</li>
	<li>content marketing is a more soft marketing approach, where visitors are allowed to consume the content they want and skim through others. The first half of content marketing (creating content) is what draws them in and prompts them to act. This approach puts the power in the hands of the reader/visitor, which is a very attractive proposition to engage better with them.</li>
</ul>
<ol start="2">
<ol start="2">
	<li><strong>Stand out competitively</strong>  Content is the key ingredient that lets your customers discover you before they discover your competition. It not only helps bring in traffic and positions your business as a thought leader, but also increases your brand visibility and loyalty. <em>Content 2020</em>, the content marketing strategy chalked out by Coca Cola is an impressive example of how brands are moving away from traditional marketing to collaborative, content-based approach.
<ol start="3">
	<li><strong>Get the customer to notice you</strong>  Great content helps prospects, customers and readers recall the value you provide. Such customer oriented experiences in turn provides a lasting brand awareness in their mind. IAB.nets research shows that 82% of B2B marketers have cited brand awareness as the top content marketing goal<strong><sup>2</sup></strong> for not one, not two, but four continuous years in a row. It amply denotes the massive influence content marketing has on improving the visibility, exposure and reach of a brand.
<ol start="4">
	<li><strong>Nurturing a relationship for a win</strong>  The stage when the prospect moves from prospecting to considering to intending to finally purchasing, is a very critical juncture of the sales and marketing funnel. Content marketing helps in the smooth transition of across these different phases. With content, you can
<ol>
	<li>Keep their interest level high by making available periodic and fresh content about their needs and how it can be addressed. This ensures that the prospect feels in charge to control his/ her purchase decision.</li>
	<li>Gain a better engagement with them at the sensitive time of considering a purchase. This ensures that the prospect goes ahead with his/ her purchase intent and thus help close a sale.</li>
</ol>
<ol start="5">
	<li><strong>Makes complete business sense</strong>  As per Demand Metric, content marketing costs 62% less than traditional marketing efforts<strong><sup>1</sup></strong> such as cold calling and mailers. But, it generates 3 times as many warm leads as traditional marketing. An extensive cost-benefit analysis is not required to see the enormous benefits that are achieved at a lower cost, when companies adopt content marketing in their marketing mix.</li>
</ol>
</li>
</ol>
</li>
</ol>
</li>
</ol>
</ol>
Right from not being in existence about a decade back, to seeing massive adoption in 2014, content marketing is definitely the way ahead for marketers. Keeping in mind a fresh and relevant message meant for a specific target audience, content marketing can create wonders in prospecting, engagement, acquisition and retention.

We believe that marketers can utilize these content marketing pointers to influence demand signals the right way. If 73% of the B2B content marketers are producing more content<strong><sup>3</sup></strong>as against the previous year, due to its tremendous sway, then its high time that your marketing team too stays invested in this effective marketing tool.

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[draft]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>66</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="category" nicename="content-marketing"><![CDATA[Content Marketing]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="marketing"><![CDATA[Marketing]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

	<item>
		<title>Mobile Application Development  A Revolution</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/?p=2908</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 06 Apr 2017 11:11:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2908</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We should not be surprised with breakneck growth of mobile adoption. Statistics show that today 3 out of every 4 people is using mobile phones on Earth. Since the introduction of iphone in the year 2007, mobile phone industry has been taken by storm opening new and advanced avenues both for the users and the mobile app developers.
Smart phones are undoubtedly becoming an eminent part of our lives, but mobile apps running on mobile devices are empowering them to make our lives easier. If we just have a look on these apps they range from shopping apps, games, entertainment, social networking, navigation, music, health, travel, hotel reservation, hiring a car and what not. All these things come in our phones helping us to do any task without moving from our place. Realising the utility of these mobile apps businesses have started promoting their brands and products through them to reach out to their audience.

<strong>What is Mobile Application?</strong>
Mobile application is a simple term as its name. it is an application developed for mobiles. Mobile apps are enjoying a larger user base and greater audience and as the mobile devices are getting advanced, so are the mobile apps getting smarter to help and ease lives of users. It is irrespective of the size and nature of your business, to reach your target audience or connect with general public, it is becoming very essential for business owners.

]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>How typography impacts your web design</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/how-typography-impacts-your-web-design/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 May 2013 08:41:55 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=692</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Typography</strong> is one of the most important elements in web design. Simply, it is the use of appropriate style, format and placement of font and text elements to make the content more engaging. Typography can be called as the technique and art of arranging type in a manner that makes language understandable and visible. This involves the proper selection of typefaces, line length, line spacing, point size and other factors like adjusting spaces between different letter groups and many other such needs.<!--more-->

<img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-693" alt="typography_techies" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/typography_techies.jpg" width="550" height="200" />

It is an important element of the designing process and makes any written matter look very enticing and attractive. Typography is considered to be the foundation of web design. Most web design companies accept and acknowledge the vital role typography has to play in the overall web design and development process.

While many people still believe that Typography is only about font selection, this simply isnt true; you need to make the type and copy look beautiful and attractive no matter what font face you select. Of course with the advent of number of services like Google Web fonts, Webtype, Typekit and Fontdeck, this task has become all the more easier, but the challenge arises when you have to make use of raw creativity and beauty for technology, without using technology!

Many designers agree with Oliver Reichensteins book <em>Web Design is 95% Typography</em> which says that there is more to a website then just pictures and design. Website content and its appearance are as critical to the sites success as multimedia. If a web designer can recreate beauty, elegance and attractiveness to a website with white space and typography, rest assured the site will definitely attract visibility on Internet.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Mistakes That A WordPress Developer Commonly Does</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/mistakes-that-a-wordpress-developer-commonly-does/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 06 Jun 2013 06:57:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=729</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: justify;">WordPress developers enjoy the fair share of their creativity along with the momentary redundancy when something goes terribly wrong. It would be a good exercise for a wordpress developer to review the mistakes that have commonly been done, so that they can learn from their folly and avoid repeating it in their daily practice.<!--more--> In this edition we are going to tell you about some of those common mistakes that a <a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wordpress">wordpress developer</a> does and how can he/she avoid making them, Here we go:-</p>
&nbsp;

<img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-733" alt="WordPress Improvement" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/06/WordPress-Customization.jpg" width="500" height="268" />

&nbsp;

<strong>1. Site Backup:</strong>

Taking the site backup is more crucial than any other step for WordPress developers. Every important update on the website is lost when a website without backup crashes or gets hacked into.To create a good backup, all a WordPress developer has to do is download the WordPress Database Backup plug-in and make it ready-to-use by choosing the components suitable to your website or blog. .

<strong>2. Posting content as an administrator:</strong>

Posting content as an administrator makes the fact that it is a WordPress site very obvious and we should try not to be transparent about this. Prospective customers may not like to see the WordPress logo on the vendors site. The best way to handle this is doing the content management using a unique user name. Please create a new contributor account to post content.

<strong>3. Using too many categories:</strong>

Using tags along with categories is very important from the point of view of SEO, loading time, and resources usage. Developers often ignore this critical part. However an effective workaround is to use this path to add tags to the main navigation  Appearance: Menus: Screen options: Turn on posts and tags.

<strong>4. Not using Cache:</strong>

WordPress sites run substantial user relevant database in the form of HTML markup language. WP sites use HTML to load the content on the webpage and every time the database is used to do this, the website may not perform well in terms of using system resources or reducing loading time. You can use two Cache Plug-Ins: W3 Total Cache and WP Super Cache to improve the website performance parameters such as speed and navigation.

<strong>5. Not getting those updates done:</strong>

It is necessary to keep in mind that without the updates your WP site becomes prone to bugs and errors. Hence, do not ignore the updates, it only takes a Click to run the updates and remember that updating now will save your valuable time later due to unpredictable bugs.

Though this is not an exhaustive list, yet we hope its a comprehensive one, to understand the power of the CMS and executing your projects in a better way. Well, this is it for now we will keep on rolling with more useful topics to make your way better towards perfection.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Why have large images backgrounds</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/why-have-large-images-backgrounds/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 24 Jun 2013 06:56:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=743</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Designing big images to create a bigger impact is a move that is getting lot of attention among website design companies recently. This is a fairly new trend that is creating stunning visual impact. Not only images but also hand drawn illustrations or animation too can be used as background for websites. Some of the key reasons for widespread usage of large impact visuals are:

	<strong>Website development practice</strong>
All over the world, data downloads is increasing in inverse proportion to charges applicable. With shrinking internet access rates, it is now a plausible reality to have large images added in on the background of the webpages without worrying about the size of the file being downloaded from the server.

	<strong>Encouraging and engaging user interaction on the web</strong>
By creating animated visuals, website developers can excite and entice the users in clicking on them to explore the website functionality. The rise in user interaction within the website turns visitors into loyal visitors and converts loyal visitors into repeat buyers. 

	<strong>Slide-Show effect</strong>
The responsiveness of the new large impact visuals does not end with its interactive and size features. In fact it is the beginning - what unfolds is even better! 

<img src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/06/large_background.jpg" alt="large_background" width="600" height="350" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-746" />

Now, your website landing page can give the client an interactive presentation of your existing work. 
Slide show effect in play:

A real estate developer can now showcase images of some of the best projects that are worth portraying on the website. Once the client opens the website URL, the client can browse through the entire portfolio of construction project.

To conclude, large image backgrounds used in websites offer significant visual appeal and thus is increasingly being used on numerous websites. In addition to create a different and eye pleasing look, it also does effective branding of the product being advertised on the site.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Impact of Parallax Web Design</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/impact-of-parallax-web-design/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 29 Jul 2013 06:26:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=750</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The Internet is an evolving space. New website design procedures are introduced regularly and most of the new procedures are designed keeping in mind shifting user preferences and newer technologies. One such newer website design procedure is Parallax designing or Parallax scrolling.

&nbsp;
<img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-758" alt="parallax" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/parallax1.jpg" width="620" height="246" />

<strong>What is Parallax Design?</strong>

<em id="__mceDel"> In parallax designing, a unique level of visual interactivity is added to a webpage. Here, the position of objects or components in a webpage is based on the position of the viewer's line of sight. Parallax designing creates a perspective shift effect for the viewer. The resulting 3D illusion created in this type is made possible by different tools such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery etc.</em>

<strong>How it Engages Audience?</strong>
Everyone who browses the internet loves to visit websites with creative visualizations and aesthetically pleasing component arrangement. With Parallax Designing, any webpage can be made engaging, thus increasing the time a user stays on the webpage and the number of return visitors. Parallax designing is most suited for single page websites and websites with entertainment content.

<strong>Parallax Web Design  The Pros</strong>

 Device Friendly

No extra plugin is required for running the websites with parallax design as the effects are driven by simple jQuery scripts.

 Single Page Design can be made more efficient

With Parallax designing, content on single page websites can be made more rich and appealing.

 High degree of creativity

Parallax is one the best techniques to keep visitors hooked on to your website, due to the sense of aesthetics and appealing look it lends to the site.

<strong>Parallax Web Design  The Cons</strong>

 Poor SEO implementation

No doubt, this approach helps come up with stunning websites. But what's the use if people don't know of them? Since Parallax is essentially a one page site, no meta tags or descriptions can be put in for SEO.

 Slow loading time

The widgets in websites and the high res images in parallax designing will take a long time in loading. It is thus unsuitable for visitors who are on a low speed data plan. This delay might not work out in favor of the client company when trying to attract an impatient Internet audience.

While there quite a few benefits to parallax designing, it is still at an early stage and we might see much more occurrences of development on this type of web designing in the near future.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Does Google+ help your SEO efforts ?</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/does-google-help-your-seo-efforts/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 Aug 2013 09:24:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=783</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[SMO, or social media marketing has evolved as a new way for getting backlinks and higher traffic for a website. People post a lot of links to social networks such as Facebook, LinkedIn and Google+ to increase traffic to their website. But is the investment worthwhile for deriving any traffic from these sources?

<img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-779" alt="googleplus &amp; seo" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/08/googleplus-seo.jpg" width="625" height="200" />

<strong>Current Google+ scenario</strong>

Posting to Google+ might or might not give you the results you want, depending on how you are using Google+. Most often people simply '+1' their post or add their URL in a Google+ post and think this would increase their website traffic. Actually, it does not. Posting to Google+ require you to know the exact places and methods from where you can get a 'do-follow' link to your website.

<b>Adding Links to the Body of Google+ posts do not help</b>

When you add a link to the body of a post in Google+, it gets you a 'no-follow' link from Google. Adding a link to the following places on Google+ would give you a 'no-follow' link:
<ul>
	<li>In the 'Other Profiles' section of your Google+ profile</li>
	<li>A link to your profile when you comment</li>
	<li>A link posted directly in a post or comment</li>
	<li>When you or someone else simple clicks the 'share' or '+1' button</li>
</ul>
A 'no-follow' link simply means that it does not give you any benefit in the search engine rankings and does not follow the link to your website.

<b>What really helps?</b>

We have discussed how sharing with a 'no-follow' tag on Google+ drives little benefit. Now, let us have a look on how to get some real benefit from this powerful social network. To ensure that your link does get followed and obtain higher SERP rankings, below are a few places on Google+ that you can post a link on.
<ul>
	<li><b>When others share your link with your name</b> - When sharing your link on Google+ in a post's body or comments, it would get a 'do-follow' link only if they +mention you in the post/comment.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><b>Sharing high PageRank</b> - The traffic gained from someone's +mention depends directly on the Google PageRank of that person. And if such a high ranking entity mentions your link, you too will derive the benefit of SEO</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><b>Add a URL</b> - If you add a valid URL using the 'add a link' button, it would in turn improve your SEO efforts.</li>
</ul>
Now when you know how to get real traffic from Google+, go and use your new found knowledge and share your views with us!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Zend Framework 2.2.2 Released</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/zend-framework-2-2-2-released/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 12 Aug 2013 07:38:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=793</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Evolving business trends and shifts in customer preferences has necessitated the creation of more dynamic websites against static ones. Dynamic websites are written mostly in 'PHP' and 'Javascript'. Though PHP codes can be written directly in a text editor, there are quite a few tools available which are based on PHP and aim to ease the web development process.

Zend Framework 2 is an open-source which is used for web development using PHP 5.3+. Combining a wide array of components, Zend Framework 2 forms a very strong tool for web development.

<img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-805" alt="zend framework 2.2.2" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/08/zend-framework-2.2.2.jpg" width="780" height="200" />

<b>Zend Framework 2.2.2 - The changes</b>

Zend Technologies has recently released Zend framework 2.2.2. The update brings over 60 changes in the framework to ease and simplify the process of web development using this particular framework. A few major points to note in this update include
<ol>
	<li>Update to the validator plugin manager which now includes a Phone number validator,</li>
	<li>Changing of the abstract methods to non-abstract in '<i>AbstractRestfulController'</i>and edited to set a 405 status ('Method not allowed')</li>
	<li>The gzip-encoded bodies will no longer be double decoded by the cURL adapter for ZendHttp</li>
	<li>The headlink() method to the Headlink View helper to match its usage to the documentation.</li>
	<li>Spelling update to the function 'GetMayorVersion' to 'GetMajorVersion'</li>
	<li>Setup() and tearDown() has updated protection so that the arguments can be changed from 'protected' to 'public' and vice-versa</li>
</ol>
&nbsp;

All of these changes were made as responses to requests or issues raised by Zend framework users on '<i>Github'</i>. Some of the major areas in development where the update shows an impact are - feature improvements, module managers and additional plugins.

<b>What happens to ZF1?</b>

The Zend Framework 1 earlier made way for Zend framework 2. With more bugs to fix and user suggestions to implements, the company has now released Zend Framework 2.2.2. But even after these updates and subsequent releases, the company plans to provide support and maintenance on ZF1 till early 2014 thus providing time to developers to carry out the technological transition from ZF1 to ZF 2.2.2.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Dependency Injection In Zend Framework 2</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/dependency-injection-in-zend-framework-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 29 Aug 2013 05:19:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1118</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Zend Framework has been right up there as one of the most preferred PHP frameworks for a long time. With massive tech community support that keeps on adding interesting and innovative features to the ZF library, it has emerged as the de-facto PHP Framework for developers globally.

<a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/08/ZF2-DI.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1127" alt="ZF2 DI" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/08/ZF2-DI.jpg" width="450" height="330" /></a>

<b>What is DI in ZF2</b>

One such feature set that was implemented into Zend Framework 2 and above, is the Dependency Injection feature, which addresses the problem of managing object dependencies. It denotes a better programming practice of writing more flexible code, that helps edit the dependent class without having to alter class' code.

In Zend Framework, Dependency Injection facilitates decoupling of the object from the class so that it no longer is applicable to just that class but is adaptable enough to be re-used in other parts of the program as well. DI will reshuffle the object's responsibilities from within the class to a new external entity. This external entity is nothing but the Controller of the relevant framework.

In Zend, the 'Zend_Controller_Action' instance will act as the Controller. However interestingly enough, this instance too is a dependent object, thus largely negating DI principles. Developers could do well to take it a level above by invoking bootstraps. In ZF2, 'Zend_Application' is a bootstrapping approach where developers use a method/class to create an object and call it as needed by a controller.

<b>Why DI?</b>
<ol>
	<li><b>Clean coding</b>  Dependency Injection goes a long way to allow developers create clean and compact codes and not define new objects every time simply because they were present inside a class.</li>
	<li><b>Re-usability of codes</b>  The best and perhaps the most critical advantage of DI in ZF2 is that the codes no longer have to be relevant to just the class within which it was defined. Through Dependency Injection using a Controller/bootstrapping option, it becomes fairly easy to re-use the method/object elsewhere in the framework rather than revising it in the parent class or creating a new object outside the class.</li>
	<li><b>Development time </b> Since developers can work around redundancies by re-using the code, a significant amount of programming and testing time is shaved off thus leading to lesser overall development time.</li>
</ol>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1118</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>Is your website mobile friendly</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/is-your-website-mobile-friendly/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 22 Aug 2013 05:33:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1120</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[A prevailing challenge for website owners is to provide similar high quality site functionality on mobile platform as on PC's. With more and more people using mobile devices like smartphones and tablets, the importance of having mobile friendly websites has shot up over time, and is now considered more a necessity than an option. Having a mobile friendly site makes it easier for businesses to give users a highly satisfactory mobile usage experience. Not only does it make logical sense for website owners to make their websites mobile friendly, it is also emerging as a step that cannot be avoided if they want good SEO for their websites.

<b>Why Mobile Friendly Sites?</b>

Two of the biggest issues that make mobile different from PC's are the screen size and limited processing power. Websites designed with computers in mind are memory intensive and often contain elements which are heavy and require high bandwidth internet to download and a lot of processing power to render. For mobile devices, a lighter version of the website is needed, containing simple design elements and lower resolution images. Having a mobile friendly site enables mobile device users to properly view and use websites, without having to suffer from prolonged loading times, skewed rendering and improper placement of elements.

<b>Google's Stand</b>

Recently, the search engine behemoth, Google has acknowledged the increase of mobile device users who frequently view websites on mobile internet, and have made some interesting changes in their SEO ranking protocols keeping in mind the interests of the mobile users. Google will now look at a variety of factors and determine the user friendliness of websites when accessed from mobile devices, and use it as one of the parameters of good SEO.

<strong>Google has suggested that websites should avoid features such as</strong>
<ol>
	<li>Flash content</li>
	<li>Faulty redirects and 404 errors</li>
	<li>Rendering errors</li>
	<li>Failure in PC-friendly video playback on mobiles</li>
	<li>Resource eating features such as heavy or high-res graphics</li>
	<li>Heavy data transfer associated with page loads</li>
</ol>
&nbsp;

These pointers will help improve the site's standing as being mobile friendly. They have also iterated that websites which use responsive web design to dynamically generate content for different devices from the same URL will be considered better for SEO purposes. To conclude, businesses that identify Google's favoritism towards mobile users will be the ones that will prosper in the current competitive scenario.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Google enrolled Penguin 2.1 Spam filtering algorithm</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/google-enrolled-penguin-2-1-spam-filtering-algorithm/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 08 Oct 2013 15:46:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1288</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[On last Friday, Matt Cutts, head of search spam at Google, announced another major step by Google for preventing Spam. This time, it is by the name of Penguin 2.1.

<a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/Penguin-2.1.png"><img src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/Penguin-2.1.png" alt="Penguin-2.1" width="360" height="360" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1287" /></a>

From quite some time, Google has been aggressively working to fight spam, and its Penguin algorithm was considered one of the most remarkable initiatives in this concern. Now, this one is the fifth time; Google has come up with a Penguin updated. 

Reportedly, it is being said that this update is not as major as Penguin 2.0 (that went live in April 2012), which claimed to affect 2.3% of search queries. This algorithm update is said to affect 1% of search queries, which is also a significant value. 

In the official announcement, Google said that the update will harm all those websites that are not providing high quality content to users. Websites that do not have relevant and useful content will notice decline in the ranking in Googles search results. 

Once again focusing on the content quality, it was said that they want people to come up with websites that are more useful for users and offer quality content. 

Adding more to this announcement, it was said that website owners that are aggressively doing SEO by adopting unethical means shall also suffer from this update. They suggested that ethical SEO techniques should be employed, instead of forceful spamming tactics.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Reasons to Choose WordPress for Building Websites</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/reasons-to-choose-wordpress-for-building-websites/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 31 Oct 2013 06:14:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1559</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Gone are the days when WordPress was the first-choice of bloggers only and considered as a perfect blogging platform only. But, scenario has changed drastically and now, Wordpress is lot more than just a blogging platform. The OpenSource platform has emerged as a potential CMS (content management system) and become the most preferred technology to build a user-friendly, easy-to-handle and content-based website.

<a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/wordpress-techies.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1560 aligncenter" alt="wordpress techies" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/wordpress-techies.png" width="500" height="357" /></a>

Even though, you will get hundreds of reasons to choose Wordpress for your website, but we are sharing a few below to support your decision.

<strong>No Dependency on Programmer</strong>
No one likes to wait for a programmer to update content on website, but you have to as you have to as you know nothing about programming or cannot working with FTP, SSH. WordPress seems like a boon to non-technical people because it allows them to update and maintain the website on your own without any handle. Just choose the theme and plugin and enjoy a fully-functional website.

<strong>Mind-Blowing Features</strong>
Wordpress is augmented with best-in-class built-in features and some of my favorite features are rich text editor, media uploader, dynamic RSS feed, etc. Overall, you get an environment in which you can manage your website independently, without any programmers help. But what if, the existing built-in features of Wordpress fail to satisfy your requirement? Well, there is no space for disappointment as there is a plugin built for it. You can extend the feature set with a WordPress plugin and fulfill your specific requirement.

<strong>Hassle-Free Maintenance</strong>
You can do nothing except banging head against the brick when your loyal programmer suddenly refused to maintain your custom-made web application. You can hire another programmer immediately, but it takes time to understand a problem and troubleshoot. But, if you have a Wordpress site, you can first handle the situation yourself and even can easily find any other developer to work on it.

<strong>Eye-feasting Templates</strong>
WordPress is renowned for flaunting a great collection of beautiful templates and themes. Even if you want to start blogging right away, you will get a plethora of FREE themes and templates to adorn your website. In an addition, all the designs come with a ton of customization options with built-in functionality.

<strong>SEO-Friendly</strong>
Search engines just love WordPress, and it is not a myth. Apart from rocking designs and features, Wordpress offers great plugins for SEO to further optimize your website.

WordPress is undoubtedly the best platform to build a website as it is 100%open source and absolutely free. If gives you freedom and flexibility to do whatever you want to do on your website with no issue.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>SEO Tips for eCommerce Website</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/seo-tips-for-ecommerce-website/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 08 Nov 2013 15:33:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1565</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It has become significantly difficult to run and get results out of an eCommerce website. Now, search engines focus more and more on the human-friendliness of the site, not products. At the same time when youre struggling hard to get a position on SERP, a growing number of online consumers also demand your attention.

<a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/ecommerce+seo.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1566 aligncenter" alt="SEO tips for eCommerce" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/ecommerce+seo.jpg" width="551" height="241" /></a>

Here we are sharing some smart SEO tips to help you to stay competitive and lead the competition by making your eCommerce website more seo-friendly. Take a look-

#<strong> Have an Interactive Website with Minimal Load Time</strong>

Having a user-friendly, engaging, appealing website that loads faster is a prerequisite. Additionally, you should plan to increase the conversion rate by adorning your website with fascinating web design, adding interactive elements, incorporating Gamification in which you allow users to leave reviews, eliminating clutter and more to deliver an overall rich user experience.

# <strong>Never Forget Panda</strong>

Google is becoming more content-centric, and its update such as Panda gives you clear idea about the significance of the quality of content in getting ranking. Panda loves human and believes that web is built to entertain and educate human. So, if youre an entrepreneur who believes in too much advertising, chuck on your plan of online shopping site. Make sure each product has unique content or put a No-index meta tag on product page which you cant write the unique content for and emphasize more on creating unique content for your category pages.

# <strong>Never stuff Your Content with Keywords</strong>

If you want to promote a keyword, be sure that the webpage is specifically and thoughtfully created for that particular keyword only. Never stuff keywords into the title, description, content, alt tag and do not interlink all your web pages excessively. Keyword density has become an asset of bygone era. Google is inkling more towards statistical data and co-citation; it is advisable to provide helpful information rather serving keywords.

# <strong>Optimize Your Site for Mobiles</strong>

A large volume of online shopping is now happening on mobile phones, so it is your call to make your website mobile compatible. Be sure that your responsive website do not consume much time, easy-to-navigate, buttons are easy to access and everything should be properly displayed on the small screen of mobile.

# <strong>Make Your Website Social</strong>

Make your eCommerce website more social so that it engages user successfully and entice them to talk about it, share it and enjoy purchasing. Create a site that works well with all social platforms. Make strategy, encourage reviews, community and photo sharing to grab attention of your potential customer. It is not all about using Facebook. Twitter, Google etc., instead it is all about how you interact with your customer.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>How Social Media benefits your Business today?</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/how-social-media-benefits-your-business-today/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 19 Nov 2013 04:58:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1571</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[In just few years Social Media has become a powerful marketing platform that could accelerate growth of any business significantly. Along with clearly identified potential and proven marketing tricks, social media offers a terrific way to promote your business, brand and products across the globe without spending a fortune.

<a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/Social-Media-Techies.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1572 aligncenter" alt="Social Media Benefits" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/Social-Media-Techies.jpg" width="346" height="346" /></a>

Many companies are now using social media to advertise their products and services as it encourages real-time conversation between brand and target market. Having said that, there are ample reasons why businesses should be using social media for business promotion and network promotion. Check out the prominent reasons-

# <strong>Generate Brand Awareness</strong>

Social media can create a notable identity for your business and products, which is very much imperative for every business, small or large. The more people come across your social media profile, the more likely they will remember your business name, which subsequently entice them to explore your website and services. Social media is an effective way to get your brand in front of potential customers and let them find your business, product and services online.

# <strong>Real-Time Open Communication</strong>

Social media is the only platform that allows businesses to approach their potential customers directly and have a real-time conversation. You can exchange information over such platforms instantly and if you do it right, the openness of social media can benefit your business tremendously. Stay open and honest during the communication to unveil the opportunities, approach new and existing customers and receive media coverage.

# <strong>Boost Up Website Traffic</strong>

High traffic influx can benefit your website and business in multiple ways and social media is a fantastic way to get new visitors for your website. You can share any specific pages of your website by offering schemes, vouchers, discounts or any useful information that visitors find useful. Additionally, provide a place to sign up for an email newsletter so that you get their contact details.

# <strong>Improve Search Engine Ranking</strong>

Search engines also consider businesss social media profiles to evaluate any website. You need to gain as many followers as you can and motivate them to promote your products, content and your business. Your search engine ranking will definitely increase as a result of your social media efforts.

#<strong> Cost-Effective Marketing &amp; Advertising</strong>

Social media marketing is affordable than traditional advertising. You can do it yourself and save a lot of money. But, as it will consume your time, it is highly advisable to hire someone to promote your website on social media platforms.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Link Building Dead or Still Alive? SEO The Right Way In 2014!</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/link-building-dead-or-still-alive-seo-the-right-way-in-2014/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 09 Jan 2014 11:09:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1590</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<style type="text/css"><!--
@page { margin: 2cm } 		P { margin-bottom: 0.21cm }
--></style>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Lets admit it. Link building isnt easy or fun anymore. Many webmasters started believing in link building is dead and start nodding heads in sideways to link building due to fear. Their fear is pretty much comprehensible as a large number of websites penalized for engaging in manipulative link schemes after Googles Penguin update.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Some have said that stopping link building altogether is the best and safest option to protect your website from penguin penalties, but that untrue.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">According to recent <strong>"<span style="color: #3366ff;">Moz search engine ranking factors survey</span></strong>", link building is still the best technique to improve visibility in the SERPs in 2014. Googles Matt Cutts also recommended link building as the best way to discover the relevancy, authenticity and importance of any businesses or person.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="color: #ff0000;"><b>Relevancy Is The New Page Rank </b></span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">The fundamental 1 link=1 vote algorithm met a dramatic change in May2012 with the introduction of knowledge graph, which was entirely based on the semantic search information. Later, the knowledge graph also changed with the latest Google algorithm, Hummingbird. Now, relevancy is the key to get PageRank when it comes to link building.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="color: #ff0000;"><b>Hummingbird</b> <b>Update</b></span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Post Hummingbird, all the links coming from high PR sites, which are not related with what is being searched by the users, will be tagged as unnatural and devalued.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="color: #ff0000;"><b>What Is Link Scheming</b></span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Buying or selling link to pass page rank, using any automated program to create link, or exchanging link just to increase count, etc. are link scheming activities, not link building. Additionally, linking your site to a web spammer or inserting links into article with little coherence will also be penalized.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="color: #ff0000;"><b>Link Schemes Or Link Building</b></span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Before panda update, webmasters were insanely following the Google paradox, in which SERPs displays different results for the spammy link building over and over again, which will not work in 2014. A link scheme that achieved no #1 ranking in 2010, may draw a manual or algorithmic penalty today. To get quality links in 2014, it is very much critical for webmasters to differentiate link building and link scheming first.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="color: #ff0000;"><b>Tips On Safe Link Building in 2014</b></span></p>

<ul>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Try to get editorial given links for external link building as they require human intervention and approval.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Build relevant links</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Focus on Quality than quantity. A few links from highly trusted websites will be more lucrative then hundreds of low quality links.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="color: #ff0000;"><b>Combining Link Building with Content Marketing</b></span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Creating high-quality content will not be enough in 2014; instead you need to learn to amplify the reach of your content. Ensure that your high-quality content is comprehensive, shareable, and formatted well within and on page with images and videos. Instead of one-time guest post, go for regular content distribution to increase your reader and brand building.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">List down all existing linkable content in a spread sheet and identify those who had received notable links and shares. Schedule one week for linker outreach to promote your existing content for active and passive link acquisition.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Well, the process of link building is expected to be touch and time consuming in 2014. Just do it right, to avoid any penalty.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><strong><span style="color: #ff6600;"><span style="color: #000000;">Hopefully, you will strategize your link building campaign accordingly in 2014</span></span><span style="color: #333300;">.</span></strong><em></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="color: #ff0000;">Dont forget to share this post if you find helpful.</span></em></p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Planning to Build the Next eBay? Keep in Mind these Guidelines to Prepare your e-Commerce Development Groundwork</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/planning-to-build-the-next-ebay/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 31 Jan 2014 15:48:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1606</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Many businesses today recognize the massive potential of online segment. Creating a shopping portal that engages successfully with the online audience is viewed as one of the most profitable business ventures of recent times. However, is a simple briefing enough for your e-commerce development service provider to get going and develop a truly world-class solution? The clear answer is No. An adequate level of preparation needs to be done before even the first meeting happens between you and your development partner.

If you dont know where to start from, below are some helpful questions whose answers will help you get started 

&nbsp;

1. <span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>Is the new development work al</strong><strong>igned to my busin</strong><strong>ess goals?</strong></span>

As a potential retailer, you need to consider if at all there is a prevalent segment that can be your strong market. Also, you need to factor in the demographics, the degree of digital penetration, spending power, and incidental charges and taxes applicable within the targeted market.

&nbsp;

2. <span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>How do others fare?</strong></span>

If you are convinced that there is a market for your shopping portal, then the next step would involve an in-depth analysis of how your competition is doing in similar conditions (i.e. over the online space). This can be accomplished by 

a. Doing a simple Google search on your target keywords, and
b. A thorough comparison of the features and degree of functionality offered by competitor websites.

&nbsp;

3. <span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>What will be included under the project specs?</strong></span>

Passed the first two stages? Now, get down to designing the project specs.
<p style="text-align: left;">a. Determine the timelines and project budget.
b. List down all the needed features as envision in the site.
c. Also pay attention to SEO strategies such as 
 Content development
 URL optimization
 Meta tagging
 Keyword analysis</p>
&nbsp;

4. <span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>What happens to my existing systems?</strong></span>

If you already have an e-commerce portal running then migrating to a different platform needs to account for migration of 

a. Catalog data
b. User login credentials
c. History of past order, payment and shipments

You may also check into the navigation and existing SEO implementation and decide if any sprucing up is required. Also over the time, policies and third party interaction might undergo a change. This will be a good point of time to get the same updated correctly, so that the site remains fresh and relevant

&nbsp;

5. <span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>Which is the right type of portal?</strong></span>

One can choose from either hosted or custom e-commerce solution. Hosted solutions are off-the-shelf, i.e. these are not owned by you but a space is allocated on external party server to host your own portal. In case of custom solutions such as Magento, there are dedicated developers that create the entire site and hand it over to you to be deployed in a space of your choice and under your control.

&nbsp;

6. <span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>Is my portal relevant to todays times?</strong></span>

Mobile and smartphones are the hot technologies that compulsorily need to have a place in your e-commerce development planning and implementation process. Not having a mobile compatible e-commerce portal means losing out on a significant (and rising) chunk of online segment that uses smartphones and tablets to do online shopping.

&nbsp;

7. <span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>Is my site marketed properly online?</strong></span>

Online segment needs unique and exclusive efforts for marketing a portal. Using Web analytics, SEO, PPC and social media integration, one can easily attract the right traffic to your website, one that has an increased chance of sales closure and hence, better business for your portal.

&nbsp;

8. <span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>Is my development vendor the right one?</strong></span>

This is a big make-or-break question. You will find choosing the right partner easier when you get answers to some critical queries as below 

a. Range of experience on the chosen development platform
b. Industry segment and category of clients worked for
c. Technical qualifications and experience of development team
d. Certifications, awards and other credentials gathered by the vendor

&nbsp;

9. <span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>Is my post-deployment plan in place?</strong></span>

You will be bound to have a continuous engagement with customers to ensure that they get the best possible online shopping experience. Keep a strong feedback channel that enables the users to provide feedback on how you can do better to keep the experience interesting. Next, you may have to reach out to your development vendors from time to time regarding these feedbacks, and subsequent tweaks, updates and adding newer content. Ensure that you get enough after-sales support from the vendors to carry these out.

As is evident, a rigorous analysis needs to be done before you outsource the e-commerce portal development work to an expert e-commerce development provider. If done right, the resulting success story is all yours to savor.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Contemplating a New Website? Ensure a Positive Impact to Sales Conversion</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/contemplating-a-new-website-ensure-a-positive-impact-to-sales-conversion/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 23 Feb 2014 10:46:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1615</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Evolving technologies has compelled many organizations to re-look at their web presence from time to time. No company would want to retain the same 90's style static website in the age of responsive design and smartphones. All this is pretty good, but what happens to the conversion rate? How will you know if your target audience will find the new site appealing enough for a successful conversion?

Below are some key points that can be taken care of at time of development process to ensure that conversion isn't impacted negatively due to revamping of website -

&nbsp;
<ol>
	<li><span style="color: #ff0000;"><b>Speed </b></span> This is a factor that can be very easily checked at time of development and testing. Speed of page load is directly proportional to conversion rate as 80% of user experience is built around how much time it takes to load a page of your site.</li>
</ol>
<i>The solution  </i>
<ol>
	<li>Google Analytics  If you are integrating this powerful tool within your website, then you can also check for speed along with the host of other features it offers. Go to 'Behavior'-&gt; 'Site Speed'-&gt; 'Overview Report'.</li>
	<li>Page load tests  PageSpeed Insights by Google and pingdom also offer page load testing and monitoring to help you gauge how is your website doing in terms of speed of page load.</li>
</ol>
In case you determine that the brand new website is lagging in speed, then it will be better to make the tweaks to eliminate speed drain culprits and then release, rather than witness the slow website take your conversion rate for a toss.

&nbsp;

2. <span style="color: #ff0000;"><b>Content</b></span>  the good thing about content is that even search engine behemoths now acknowledge its criticality. With the recent Hummingbird algorithm updates, Google has made it clear that it will prefer those sites that have meaningful and relevant content rather than keyword stuffed content.

<i>The solution  </i>

Having a well-researched and well written content is just one side of the story. Molding the content  to answer exactly what your customers are looking for, is a totally different ball game altogether. For  instance, writing on a new home cleaning product available can be accomplished by blogging on "Tips  for better home cleaning" rather than "XT-35 with round bristles now available", because it is the  former that the users will query for.

&nbsp;

3. <span style="color: #ff0000;"><b>SEO</b></span>  This is the best way to propel your conversion rate (or lose out on it). While being technologically advanced, your website needs to embrace SEO qualities without which it will not be noticed by the users or your target audience. If the new site doesn't adhere to prevalent SEO norms, then say goodbye to positive conversion.

<i>The solution  </i>
<ol>
	<li>Meaningful URLs  www.abc.com/blog/top-10-apps.html certainly looks better than www.abc.com/cgi-bin/s=23</li>
	<li>Re-directs  Make sure that all 301/302 re-directs do not lead to a dead end</li>
	<li>Webmaster tools  Use Bing tools and Google webmaster tools. With this search engine giants allow your customers to find you before your competitors</li>
</ol>
&nbsp;

Technology has proved to be the biggest disruptive force of recent times, thus inducing companies to re-design their websites. By referring to these points in the development stage, make sure that the re-design isn't at the cost of conversion.]]></content:encoded>
