	<item>
		<title>Optimize your LinkedIn Business Page in Quick Steps</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/optimize-your-linkedin-business-page-in-quick-steps/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 29 Apr 2014 07:19:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1714</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Creating dedicated networking and significant lead generation chances needs the backing of a worldwide professional networking site and what better than LinkedIn for this purpose? With 29 million users connected across the globe, LinkedIn comes across as one of the best places to grow your contacts and generate leads. But a lot of it depends on how you project your corporate image in the site. It is here that a strong <b>Linkedin Business Page</b> comes in handy. <b>Social Media marketing companies</b> are increasingly embracing <b>LinkedIn Optimization</b> as the way to deliver stunning results and create remarkable opportunities using the prowess of LinkedIn.

If you are entrusted with enhancing the visibility of your website but do not know where to begin, then we present to you eight effective <b>SMO</b> steps in which your <b>LinkedIn Business Page</b> can become a powerful magnet to pull target audience attention and improve business potential. These are categorized under two sections  Preparing your <i>LinkedIn Business Page</i> and <i>Marketing your LinkedIn Business Page</i>. So, here we go!

<span style="color: #ff0000;"><i>Preparing your LinkedIn Page</i></span>

1. Use LinkedIn vanity URL  This is a boon to help people easily relate to your brand or company. Instead of having a long and hard to remember URL such as www, you can instead customize it and give a more meaningful URL that audience will recognize and relate to.

Go to Setting -&gt; Profile -&gt; Helpful links -&gt; Edit your public profile. In the bottom right box you can see a link Customize your public profile URL

2. Add external links innovatively  Personal Website, Company Website and Blog are some commonly used external link categories by administrators. However not many know that we can create customized labels/categories, for easy grouping or anchor text display. This feature helps make the link more appealing to the viewers for such external links.

Go to top tab -&gt; Profile -&gt; Edit Profile -&gt; Edit Contact info (this is placed just when the section having the profile photo ends). Click on the pencil next to Websites -&gt; Chose Other from the first drop down list. This way you can add custom anchor text to your external links.

3. Optimize profile for SEO  Many businesses can also profit by adding their keywords to the headings and title of the LinkedIn page. This comes in especially handy for new businesses whose own websites havent yet been able to make it through the top on SERPs. Be aware of what words your target audience would query in Google search engine that aligns to your offerings. Then add these words so that the positive ranking of LinkedIn will rub onto your LinkedIn profile and thus be discovered by more and more targeted people.

4. Add multimedia  Adding samples and marketing materials help provide an enriching and engaging experience for the <b>LinkedIn Business Page</b>. It also converts the profile into gripping social media for businesses. Slideshows, presentations, free whitepapers, press releases and news updates about the organizations creates a sustained buzz amongst people and helps increase the number of people who are aware of your brand.

<span style="color: #ff0000;"><i>Marketing your LinkedIn Business Page</i></span>

Now that you have readied the company page to be unleashed on <b>Social Media for Business</b>, go and do just that  unleash it on the world! Some ways in which you can expand the amount of coverage the business page garners are as follows -

5. Optimize business page  The overall look and feel of Company Pages has evolved numerous times over years. Make sure that your business page is optimized to follow the latest theme. This helps prevent the page from looking outdated. For instance, as of April 2014, LinkedIn no longer supports Products &amp; Services Page under Business page. Moderators will now have to put the relevant content under Showcase Pages and Company Updates. Learn more about these in the following points.

6. Create targeted showcase pages and Company updates  These are two new features added for <b>LinkedIn optimisation</b>. They allow companies to tell the followers more about what type of offerings are provided by them.

a. Showcase Pages  They provide a more personalized experience to readers by creating dedicated space for your main brands and services. This page operates fairly independent of the company profile page, thus allowing companies to cater to a niche segment in a specific way.

Click on Edit drop down box at the top right corner of the profile page and select Create a Showcase Page.

b. Add updates to company status  This section is a central location where readers can view all types of updates around the company and news stories about the same.

Administrators can go to Home -&gt; Share an update and post update. They can also add rich text or URLs

7. Generate leads  Thats why we use LinkedIn right? Recent studies have proved that LinkedIn offer better lead generation prospects than both Twitter and Facebook. To maximize your lead closure chances, make sure that you post regular updates on the company page, keep it up to date and relevant, and promote and share links frequently.

8. Get insights into LinkedIn marketing  Page Insights provides insightful stats on how your LinkedIn page is performing in terms of visibility and activity as a <b>social media for business</b>. Important figures and trends pertaining to status updates, reader engagement and coverage are tracked. These numbers and trends help in companys decision making on how value can be extracted better from the page.

Content Marketing Score is another captivating feature that takes into account the engagement seen in Company Pages, Sponsored Updates, Groups and employee updates and compares it with competitors in the same domain for the same categories.

Hope these eight steps lead you in the right direction in how you can utilize the immense potential of <b>LinkedIn Business Pages</b> for <b>Social Media Optimization</b>. Leave your comments below and let us know.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Steps to install PHPUnit 3.7 on Ubuntu</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/steps-to-install-phpunit-3-7-on-ubuntu/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 17 Jun 2014 06:13:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1721</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This installation will be done using Composer, modern php dependency manager.

<strong>1. Install Composer:</strong>

<code>curl -sS https://getcomposer.org/installer | php;</code>
&nbsp;
<strong>2. Move composer to executable place:</strong>

<code>mv composer.phar /usr/local/bin/composer;</code>
&nbsp;
<strong>3. Install PHPUnit and required packages:</strong>

<code>composer global require "phpunit/phpunit=3.7.*";
composer global require "phpunit/phpunit-selenium": "&gt;=1.2";
composer global require "phpunit/phpunit-story": "&gt;=1.0";
composer global require "phpunit/dbunit": "&gt;=1.2";
composer global require "phpunit/php-invoker": "&gt;=1.1";</code>

Thats it!

]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>How to measure RoI of SEO Campaign</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/how-to-measure-roi-of-seo-campaign/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 09 Jul 2014 11:22:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1746</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[SEO has proved to be a critical driver of targeted web traffic and online revenue generator for businesses across the globe.In case you are putting in efforts to optimise your website as per SEO strategies, you also need to put in a measure in place to ensure that you are getting absolute value for SEO efforts. In the competitive B2B industry where every move is correlated to the value it adds to a business bottom line, having a measurable RoI form SEO efforts is a great way to explore the gains in terms of business volume.

<img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1747" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Measure-ROI-of-Your-SEO-Campaign.png" alt="ROI-SEO" width="640" height="380" />

While there are a number of tools to highlight the efficacy of SEO strategies, a few like Google Analytics and Positionly are widely acclaimed. These tools comewith the unique and alluring proposition of free usage and comprehensive feature sets that appeal to businesses. Below is a listing of some of the metrics from the analytics tools that shows the RoI of SEO efforts for a website.

1. <strong>Quality Inbound links</strong> Google gives great weightage to the amount of other websites that link to your site. It also tells Google what kind of subject matter expert is the company and assigns page rank based on this. Tools like Majestic SEO helps businesses understand and monitor the volume of inbound links being generated over a period of time.

2. <strong>Keyword ranking</strong>  When we are targeting the first page of Google to increase conversion, we need to pay careful attention to keywords that come up in users search query. When we target the most competitive few keywords, we see that significant SEO efforts will need to go into these to generate minimal results. On the other hand if we target the less competitive keywords that comprise of the long tail, we might get encouraging results and ensure that our optimisation endeavours pays off well.

3. <strong>Traffic volume</strong>  Once you have gained the upper hand in enhancing visibility, you also need to execute the second step of making visitors come to the website. Select the different parameters in Visitors Flow report in the Google Analytics tool to search amount of visitors by different parameters such as country, browser type, language etc. Also companies can measure the volume of organic visits and other visits.

4. <strong>Traffic quality</strong>  Once you have got a gist of the volumeof web traffic you need to gauge its quality to maximize your chances of sales conversion. Metrics such as in-site stay duration, page views and number of pages per visit help you gain appropriate insights. For instance 2.5 pages per visit or above is considered a good sign of the level of engagement your website has with targeted customers.

5. <strong>Conversion</strong> You can track goal based conversion to see how effective your SEO strategies are. For instance, if improving potential business leads is your goal you need to track various sources of contacts such as phones, mails or appointments. Also clearly distinguish between organic conversions and other types of conversion for best conversion tracking. Conversions also result from visitors subscription to various call-to-actions such as e-book downloads, newsletter subscribing and social media shares/likes.

These steps are great ways to ensure that the time, efforts and money are utilised effectively. While determining RoI cannot come under the purview of fixed series of steps, there are different ways and combinations that can be utilised to track the performance of your SEO campaign.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Enhance your Website through Superb Navigation Experience</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/enhance-your-website-through-superb-navigation-experience/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 16 Jul 2014 12:55:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1750</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The fine art of digital selling involves quite a few steps of attracting visitors to your site (through strong SEO strategies) and keeping their interest alive long enough to convince them to go for your respective call-to-action (content). The bridge that allows site visitors to cross over from initial interest to sustained excitement in using the site is navigation. This element is vital alongwith SEO strategizing (to attract web traffic) and developing engaging content (to help convert visitors to sales prospects).

<a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/enhance-user-friendly-website-navigation.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-1751" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/enhance-user-friendly-website-navigation.png" alt="User Friendly Website Navigation" width="500" height="311" /></a>

Once the visitor has been attracted to the site to read through the content, he or she will also be influenced by the degree of ease offered by various ancillary elements such as usage of eye pleasing color combinations, navigation and user interface. Taking care of the navigation will ensure a fantastic response to call to action in your webpage and prevent abandonment. Here are a few ways you can ensure a good navigation experience for you site visitors 

<strong>1. Incorporate navigation in planning </strong>

Delivering a superb navigation experience needs focus from planning stage itself. Cutting down on load time, keeping an un-cluttered layout and having cross device consistency are key drivers that help eliminate webpage abandonment and better chances of sales conversion

<strong>2. Simplicity and clarity is the key</strong>

Keeping navigation through menu elements entails paying attention to smaller details that doesnt leave a visitor dissatisfied. Keep different on-key color themes to let a visitor easily distinguish between hover, disabled or active menu element. Also do not go to more than 3 levels deep in categorizing information under menus and sub-menus. Also make sure that the menu items are prominently displayed at proper place. The current standard is keeping menu elements on the top right corner just above the banner graphic/text.

<strong>3. Focus on linking</strong>

Ensure that links are accurate, organized, relevant and related. In case of blog posts or discussions on a particular topic, readers can be kept interested with related posts that links to other posts with a similar theme or line of discussion.

<strong>4. Ensure any-page navigation</strong>

An industry standard best practice is to ensure that visitors can go to any page in the site from any page. Keeping a standard tile of menu items at the top will be a great idea. Also many experts advocate the use of company logo at the top left corner to be used to link to the home page.

<strong>5. Be consistent</strong>

Uniform color theme, design and font style on all the webpages goes a long way in providing a confusion-free website surfing. Imagine going from a grey-blue theme on one page to a pink-orange theme to another. While variety is a spice of life, it certainly doesnt hold true for webpages within a site.

<strong>6. Keep user friendliness as the end goal</strong>

Use easy to understand terms and words so that visitors can easily find the desired information without wasting unnecessary time. For instance, a menu element team can be re-worded to Meet the team so that the visitor knows what to expect upon clicking on the link/button.

Navigation is the key to great user experience, prolonged site stay and increased chances of sales closure. Follow these simple steps and your website will not let your marketing efforts down.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Panda 4.1 rolling out  What it means for Internet Marketers?</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/panda-4-1-rolling-means-internet-marketers/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 30 Sep 2014 14:11:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1868</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This week saw frantic activity from GoogleLand with the rolling out of the newest update on Googles Panda algorithm. At the heart of this small yet significant update is Googles move to strengthen the focus on high quality content and penalize sites that have thin or poor content. While it has started a phase-wise roll-out, Google expects this to be fully implemented by end of next week. Lets look at what this update entails -

<a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/Google-Panda-4.1-Rolled-Out-2014.jpg"><img class="wp-image-1870 size-full aligncenter" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/Google-Panda-4.1-Rolled-Out-2014.jpg" alt="Google Panda 4.1 Rolled Out 2014" width="542" height="300" /></a>

<strong>Change details</strong>
Reportedly around 3% to 5% of the search queries will face the immediate impact of this new update. Googles update to its crawling signals combined with feedback from users and webmasters has made it possible to identify low quality content. The official announcement by Google says
Based on user (and webmaster!) feedback, weve been able to discover a few more signals to help Panda identify low-quality content more precisely. This results in a greater diversity of high-quality small- and medium-sized sites ranking higher, which is nice.

<strong>Should web marketers be worried?</strong>
If you are an Internet marketer with a core focus on providing relevant, up-to-date and meaningful, this update is bound to have little effect on your marketing strategy. Continue posting timely, applicable content and keep monitoring through Google Analytics. Review your existing content and if it needs replacing, then please do so.

Additionally Panda 4.1 seeks to incentivize marketers who took efforts to work on penalties from previous versions of Panda update and corrected their content strategy.So this is good time to your all published content and update with more subject matter and less keyword stuffing. Make sure that all steps you take adheres to Googles standards. This in turn will help your SERP improvement endeavors

Share with us your views on how the 27th Panda algorithm update will affect your online marketing and SEO strategy in the coming months.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>8 Reasons this year&#039;s Zendcon is going to be special</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/8-reasons-this-years-zendcon-going-special/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Oct 2014 12:08:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1917</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p align="JUSTIFY">PHP enthusiasts and developers who love to work with the Zend Framework can rejoice as it is time for the 10<sup>th</sup> Zendcon. Scheduled for October 27-30 at Santa Clara, CA, the event is a massively popular community congregation of developers and enthusiasts. Zendcon is a great place to listen to PHP thought leaders on everything in Zend. They can communicate and form business relationships too along the way. The conference is a treasure trove of information, insights and inspiration for Zend professionals such as Techies India Inc. You can also exchange ideas and gain knowledgeable insight from intense yet high quality technical lessons. There are many reasons why this years Zendcon promises to be truly special and interesting. Read on to know more </p>


[caption id="attachment_1918" align="aligncenter" width="419"]<a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Techies.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-1918" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Techies.png" alt="Zend Con 2014" width="419" height="201" /></a> Zend Con Santa Clara 2014[/caption]

 Zendcon 2014 features extensive discussion about DevOps and industry best practices concerning continuous software delivery, enabling you to automate and streamline your delivery process for best results.

 For those who want to chalk out the perfect technology road map for the coming years and reach business goals in a market that is changing rapidly, Zendcon will be a godsend with a full track devoted exclusively to application architecture, including cloud, mobile and APIs.

 PHP developers need to keep themselves updated about the latest coding best practices, tips and tricks. At Zendcon, you can learn from acknowledged experts in the field from around the world.

 Communicate and share with developers from all corners of the globe, learn about their techniques and modus operandi, and share yours for great networking.

 If you want to improve your expertise, you can avail a 50% discount on the Zend certification exam if you enroll during Zendcon.

 Great technology can inspire and motivate. At Zendcon, you can see demos of the best technology and tools currently being used, in the exhibit hall. Watch, learn and get creative in your own work.

 Keynote speeches at Zendcon deal about current and important challenges and opportunities of the industry, and you can gain insight and broaden your outlook.

 Sign up for the special Zendcon pre-conference tutorials to add more tools to your developers toolbox.

Techies India Inc. will be an active participant at Zendcon this year. Write in to us and let us know if you would be participating in the Zendcon this year.

<strong>See you there!</strong>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Its Dublin calling for Techies India Inc. See you there on November 4th</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/dublin-calling-techies-india-see-november-4th/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 24 Oct 2014 08:18:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1929</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p align="JUSTIFY">What started as an annual conference in 2010 has rapidly turned out to be the biggest show on Earth for geeks and tech superstars from around the world. Dubbed as Davos for Geeks by Bloomberg, the Dublin Web Summit is fast emerging as the greatest technology event. With huge impetus from leading minds from some of the biggest names in technology, the event is an interesting platform for convergence of ideas, people and potential opportunities. This year is going to be no different. With over 20,000 attendees, more than 350 eminent speakers and nearly 2000 new businesses showcasing their competencies, the summit is expected to raise the bar higher than its previous editions.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><i><b>Who is going to be there?</b></i></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Distinguished names would grace the occasion with their insights on evolving trends and emerging opportunities within the technology landscape. This year brings technology visionaries such as Werner Vogels (CTO, Amazon), Padmasree Warrior (Chief Technology &amp; Strategy Officer, Cisco), Anna Patterson (VP-Engineering, Google) and John Sculley (former CEO, Apple) on the speakers dais at Dublin between Nov 4<sup>th</sup> to 6<sup>th</sup></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><i><b>Why DWS for emerging small businesses?</b></i></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Dublin Web Summit (DWS) is one of its kind opportunity for emerging leaders in IT/Telecom sector to be in the front and center of a truly international and arguably the biggest technology platform of the world. This coveted event is sure to give them significant exposure to changing customer preferences and open up newer avenues for their benefit. It will also help them connect with potential investor groups and give a thrust to their business ramp-up objectives.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Make the most of your time with investors at Dublin Web Conference</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/make-time-investors-dublin-web-conference/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 28 Oct 2014 08:06:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=1931</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p align="JUSTIFY">The upcoming 3-day Dublin Web Summit starting November 4<sup>th</sup> has garnered substantial excitement on the Internet and in the corridors of technology companies. It presents early startups and up and coming technology companies the much needed platform to soar high on the growth path, thanks to the significant investor interest, worldwide coverage and international exposure. In order to make the most of your limited time and huge investor visibility, heres a lowdown of what VCs actually look for in such a coveted and much celebrated event </p>

<ol>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Extremely important  In various order of priority the three main elements that VCs will look for in your presentation will be</p>

<ol>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Fabulous team</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Excellent product/solution</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Attractive demand market</p>
</li>
</ol>
</li>
</ol>
<p align="JUSTIFY"></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">In case you are just starting up with a business idea then concentrate on showcasing your team strengths and its future scalability options. For established business VCs will look at how the market is reacting to the product/solution put forth by them.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"></p>

<ol start="2">
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Entrepreneur analysis  Many VCs vouch for a great entrepreneur who can carry off and deliver upon a great idea. They view that with a good idea, a good entrepreneur backing it with dedication and passion is a necessity else the investment will be a waste</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Experience  The one thing that investors truly appreciate is a domain experience that is on a pre-eminent level. In case you possess deep experience within your niche, it is considered as an upside potential to show handsome returns on the VCs investment</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Execution  Upon funding, investor like to see how their investment is shaping up. One of the earliest signs of a good investment is the level of understanding the business has for its clients and how they can bet solve the problems. Past portfolios, design prototypes and solution construct will serve as valuable tools to showcase your commitment to flawless execution</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p align="JUSTIFY">So, good luck with your exciting journey at Dublin Web Summit and see you around.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Is App Development on Your Agenda? Then Read This First.</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/app-development-agenda-read-first/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 13 Nov 2014 11:40:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2033</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Changing technology landscape and evolving user preferences have created an attractive demand market for mobile apps. In case you want to capitalize on this surge in demand or want to develop an enterprise app for your business, you would surely be interested in learning from our experiences. Towards this, we bring to you a few key pointers that will help you get going and stay on the right path in mobile app development 
<ul>
	<li>Select your platform carefully  While Apple is popular in US and Europe, Android is dominant in Asia-Pacific and Africa. Consider your target audience and develop the app on a single platform first.</li>
	<li>Type of app  Going for native or web app or hybrid? You need to decide on the average Internet penetration in the target market to deicide the right type of app to be developed. For instance, going for native app might be more feasible in Asia where Internet bandwidth and coverage is low.</li>
	<li>Process is the key  Do adhere to industry practices when developing app to keep your project ad budget on track. Going through the process of brainstorming, wire-framing, basic functionality and full-fledged app release will help ensure that the final product is as per expectations</li>
	<li>Dont avoid testing  Many developers rush through app release without testing it comprehensively. Do make sure that all scenarios and use cases are considered and tested thoroughly. This will also help in quick adoption of the app and boost downloads.</li>
	<li>App store protocols  Apple and Android follow their own system of protocols that need to be complied with for app store release. Do make certain that your app takes this into consideration at time of app development and testing</li>
	<li>Feedback is crucial  Your users are the key to your app success. When you provide them the means to listen to their views and opinions, your app can only get better through updates that incorporates their views</li>
	<li>App Marketing  Employ the services of a competent app marketing agency to drive app visibility and coverage higher. Gaining traction and interest on social media and Internet will help in volume of app downloads eventually.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Disparities between Node.js and JavaScript</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/disparities-node-js-javascript/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 18 Nov 2014 07:03:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2046</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[JavaScript has been around for a long time. A popular client-side coding language that is designed to be used in a web browser, it has been popularly used by developers and designers for many years. Over time, there have been quite a significant number of frameworks and tools built around JavaScript for ease of use and added functionality. One such tool which has become immensely popular among developers the world over is Node.js.
Node.js is basically JavaScript with a different purpose. It does not have JavaScript essentials like the DOM or Document Object Module which deals with particular elements on a webpage. Nor does it have browser APIs. They are both single-thread tools which are event driven. There are, however, major differences between the two.
In order to make a productive contribution to your development projects, it is vital that you are aware of these subtle differences. While JavaScript is a client-side language, Node.js brings the server-side programming and development opportunities which allow developers to work with a single programming language for both their front-end and back-end requirements. Some important points of difference are outlined below -
<ul>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">While JavaScript runs from a browser and allows manipulation of webpage elements, Node.js can be run from the command line without a browser. It uses Chromes V8 engine- Google Chromes JavaScript engine.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">JavaScript is strictly a client-side resource which operates from a browser inside a sandbox. Node.js, on the other hand, can be used as a server-side resource, enabling developers to use JavaScript on the server as well as on the client-side.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Node.js places greater focus on input and output interactions. This makes it a great tool for designing backend APIs. JavaScript cannot be used for server-side application and therefore has no implication when it comes to designing backend APIs.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Node.js also comes with the node package manager- an application dependency manager which developers can use to interface with various resources and utilize code snippets from other developers.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><a name="_GoBack"></a>With these notable differences, it is clear that the scope of these two coding languages is vastly different. While JavaScript is good for client-side operations and dynamically making changes to a webpage by using DOMs, Node.js is essentially a server-side resource with which developers can create a solid backbone for their web applications.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Why AngularJS Is Becoming Favorite MVC Framework For Many Businesses?</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/angularjs-becoming-favorite-mvc-framework-many-businesses/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 27 Nov 2014 12:31:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2051</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="margin-bottom: 0in;" align="JUSTIFY"><a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/angular-featured.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-2052 aligncenter" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/angular-featured.png" alt="angular-featured" width="831" height="468" /></a></p>
<p style="margin-bottom: 0in;" align="JUSTIFY"><span lang="en-US">Its been two years since the launch of multiple Javascript MVC frameworks. However, AngularJS has towered way above others in this short span of time and rightly so. Maintained by Google, the key USP of the framework is to make the coding and testing much easier using MVC architecture. Google Trends analysis clearly shows that other frameworks introduced at around the same time  Knockout JS or Ember or Backbone JS  lag behind AngularJS in a big way. While we do not mean to put down other JS, this blog simply provides reasons why AngularJS is our favorite framework.</span></p>
<p style="margin-bottom: 0in;" align="JUSTIFY"><span lang="en-US">Here are some reasons why we feel this framework will be a good fit for enterprise-level needs  </span></p>

<ol>
	<li>
<p style="margin-bottom: 0in;" align="JUSTIFY"><span lang="en-US">Ease of data binding  With freedom from explicit declaration of properties and dependencies, code duplication is reduced. For example to display details about contact, no more need to define contact table, a server-side contact domain object, a contact JSON object and a client-side contact object. </span></p>
</li>
	<li>
<p style="margin-bottom: 0in;" align="JUSTIFY"><span lang="en-US">Dependency Injection  Using this vital highlight of the framework, it can bring server-side capabilities such as view dependent controllers or client-side web applications, thus reducing load on the server</span></p>
</li>
	<li>
<p style="margin-bottom: 0in;" align="JUSTIFY"><span lang="en-US">Testing made easy  Angular incorporates both test-driven and behavior-driven testing to help test all components right from business logic of the code to UI behaviors </span></p>
</li>
	<li>
<p lang="en-US" style="margin-bottom: 0in;" align="JUSTIFY">Development control  Angular provides Directives that allow developers to build new HTML elements or attributes. As a plus point these directives can be passed through the testings systems, can be worked upon in parallel by multiple developers and can be involved in dependency injection.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p lang="en-US" style="margin-bottom: 0in;" align="JUSTIFY">Works with Single Page Applications  With the Web design world shifting toward single page applications to replicate and provide uniformity for the app experience on mobile and web, SPA applications have gained much traction. Angular helps address many of the challenges that are encountered when developing single page applications.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p style="margin-bottom: 0in;" align="JUSTIFY"><span lang="en-US">MVC implementation  Coding and development becomes much easier when MVC architecture is implemented. Angular uses MVC model that helps to separate out the presentation, business logic and data components for ease of managing the entire project. </span></p>
</li>
</ol>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>Tips to follow official HIG by Apple in iOS app design</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/tips-follow-official-hig-apple-ios-app-design/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 02 Dec 2014 13:04:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2055</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p align="JUSTIFY"><a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/ios-app-design.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2056" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/ios-app-design.png" alt="ios-app-design" width="1200" height="881" /></a></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Apple is well-known for producing quality devices that guarantee users a rich, immersive usage experience. To help maintain their high standards, Apple is also considered to be rigid and insistent that app designers follow their lead and adopt the design choices that are in sync with Apples own. To facilitate this, Apple has in place a detailed and binding HIG (Human Interface Guidelines) that app designers need to follow if they want their apps to get approval at the Apple app store. Known to be sticklers for the rules and for high quality work, the people at Apple only approve apps which follow their official HIG. If you are a developer and aspire to create an app for the iOS platform, you need to first achieve complete comprehension of the HIG and internalize its concepts before you start planning your app.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><b>First Steps</b></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">To ensure that your app follows the HIG set by Apple, you need to understand their philosophy and mindset. Apple have let us know that iOS is all about three factors </p>

<ul>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><b>Deference</b> of the UI towards the content,</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><b>Clarity</b> of all UI elements, and</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><b>Depth </b>of colors and layers to enhance the experience.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p align="JUSTIFY">In accordance to these themes, here are a few ideas that you need to consider and adopt </p>

<ul>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Develop an in-depth understanding of the iOS design policies and what Apple considers to be good enough in the field of app anatomy, layout, navigation, animation, terminology, typography, the use of color, graphic elements and icons.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Study successful iOS apps and their journey from a concept to a finished product and understand the important steps in between.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Learn about different technologies that iOS supports and devise creative ways to integrate those technologies that are relevant to your concept.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Get up to speed about the different UI elements and styles that highly regarded iOS apps use and form a mental image of the way they provide navigation and display their content.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Pay special attention to the graphic elements and icons that you intend to use. Having the right vibe with your icons and launch images will let you score heavily with Apple.</p>
</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Do you know what it takes to create a successful Google Adwords strategy?</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/know-takes-create-successful-google-adwords-strategy/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 10 Dec 2014 13:04:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2064</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Its not rocket science and anyone can do it. It just requires a little effort to make your campaign a real success.

<img src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/QA-Design-tarun1.jpg" alt="Q&amp;A-Design-tarun" width="594" height="773" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2068" />

If you are new to Google adwords then look into the info-graphic below to see how Google adwords auction works.

<img src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/what-is-google.jpg" alt="what-is-google" width="1000" height="4944" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2078" />

Courtesy: Wordstream

From the infographic you can infer that AD Rank is the most important factor while calculating the actual CPC of a keyword. If you have higher ad rank you will spend the least amount on a keyword than your competition. To improve AD rank you need to work on Quality score of your keywords. 

Quality score is basically nothing but how relevant your ad is to the user. It depends upon the keywords you have selected, how good is your ad copy and finally landing page. If all these things are relevant your keywords will definitely have good quality score. 

But even after knowing all these things we dont get the desired results. One reason can be not experimenting and exploring the opportunities.  We are either spending over or under than its required.

If you are not sure about how much to spend on your adwords then you can simply follow 2 things. Either start with the least amount or touch the peak. Both these strategies will allow you to reach a balanced point.

If your budget is limited then always start with the first approach so that you can utilize your amount in best possible manner. Start with the least and see your standings in terms of ranking. Start pushing your budget higher and track the changes.

If budget is not an issue than place higher bids to beat the competition and keep lowering your bids to see how your ads are performing. 

By following these 2 strategies you will touch a point where your adwords account is well balanced and optimized in terms of spending. But remember one thing this will not happen in a day and it requires constant efforts and experiments to reach this level.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Why to Practise Swift Programming Language ?</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/practise-swift-programming-language/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 17 Dec 2014 07:11:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2081</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;">Swift is an emerging language with a great combination of cleaner version perhaps a <b>familiar syntax, modern language and superb backward compatibility </b>features, which makes it better while developing applications for iOS and OS X apps.</span>It is built with LLVM framework included in Xcode 6.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/QA-Design.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2087" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/QA-Design.jpg" alt="Q&amp;A-Design" width="594" height="773" /></a></p>

<h2 align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>Swift Featuring - Type Inference</b></span></h2>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;">The vital ability provided by <b>Apple </b>in Swift is <b>Type inference</b>, as programmer does not need to annotate values with its type whether value is constant or variable. Lets understand this with an example:</span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY">We have a value which depicts a name.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><strong><em><span style="font-size: medium;">let name = John // automatically inferred</span></em></strong></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><strong><em><span style="font-size: medium;">or </span></em></strong></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><strong><em><span style="font-size: medium;">let name : String = John //explicit case</span></em></strong></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;">In Swift , String is as much powerful as NSString in Objective C whereas let defines that you have declared the value as constant value.</span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>var integerValue = 42 //automatically inferred variable integer value</b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;">Now, here variable means values can be changed as per the requirement.</span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;">Interestingly, Swift gives the utility to use <b>emoticons </b>and no use of <b>semi colons. </b>Programmer can make combinations of string,characters.</span></p>

<h2 align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>Swift Featuring - String Interpolations </b></span></h2>
<p align="JUSTIFY">To use string interpolation ,simple wrap parentheses around any type you want to include in the strings and prefix it with a backslash.</p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>let friendName = Daniel</b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>var commonFriends = 5</b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>let result = My Friend name is \(friendName) and we have \(commonFriends) friends in common.</b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>println(result) </b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>// Output = My Friend name is Daniel and we have 5 friends in common.</b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>Swift Featuring - String Mutability </b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;">Swift provides mutability features for String and also for its Collection Types (Dictionary, Array) which make it relatively easy for programmers.</span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>var variableString = Some string</b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>variableString += has literal value </b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>or </b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>variableString = variableString + has literal value</b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>println(variableString)</b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>//result - Some String has literal value</b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;">Similarly , it provides mutability of Arrays and Dictionary. Simple declaration of Array and Dictionary is as follows :-</span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>var names = [Brian, John, Melan] //String array </b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>var numberOfBooks = [Brian : 5, John : 4, Melan : 5] </b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>//Dictionary with String type key and correspondent integer values.</b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;">Now the question arises, if we need to modify or mutate these collection types - how can we do that? Here is the example which explains the solution -</span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>names += [Edward] // Addition of single element in names Array</b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>names [5...7] = [Celesty, Maya, Vella] </b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>//Addition of elements in names Array with particular range</b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>numberOfBooks [Vella] = 10 </b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>// Addition of key Vella with value 10 in nuumberOfBooks Dictionary</b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>numberOfBooks [Melan] = 8 </b></span></em></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><em><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>// Modifying value for key Melan in nuumberOfBooks Dictionary</b></span></em></p>

<h2 align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>Swift vs Objective C</b></span></h2>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;">On Contrary to Objective c , Swift does not create pointers and unsafe accessors. It is designed in a way that it never let programmer face exceptions.</span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;">There are number of such utilities provided by swift language for developers.Some of these are :-</span></p>

<ul>
	<li><b>Declaring optional and non optional values,</b></li>
	<li><b>Support for generic class and functions,</b></li>
	<li><b>Trailing Closures,</b></li>
	<li><b>Class like Structs etc.</b></li>
</ul>
<a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/maxresdefault.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2086" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/maxresdefault.jpg" alt="maxresdefault" width="1280" height="800" /></a>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;">Swift provides multiple returning value functions, or it can be explained as one return value containing tuples at calling site.</span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;">Swift uses ARC (Automatic Reference Counting) to manage memory. ARC consists of Initialization and deinitialization of objects. It also enhances the tool to protect against mistakes and bugs,providing feature like Playground. Playground helps the programmer to have look on the results immediately while programming with interactive views.</span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="font-size: medium;">The key element of Swift is the ability of clean debugging and run within developing environment.</span></p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>How to create content that sells</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/create-content-sells/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 19 Dec 2014 11:08:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2091</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="color: #000000;">Content Marketing has been around for a while and by this time you probably might know what content marketing actually is. But lets quickly look into what content marketing means,</span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="color: #000000;"><em>Content marketing is a marketing technique of creating and distributing valuable, relevant and consistent content to attract and acquire clearly defined audience  with the objective of driving appropriate customer action.</em></span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="color: #000000;">Content Marketing is your Super-Salesman targeting young and old, wealthy and not so wealthy, male or female. Every time you prepare content keep in mind that the idea should be such that conveys its meaning and not the high flying things which attracts customers attention but it does not know what it means.</span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="color: #000000;">Basically, content marketing is the art of providing information to your customers and prospects without selling. It is the way you are making your customer more intelligent and telling it the things it does not know, thereby making it intelligent. It is non-interruption marketing. The essence of content marketing is the belief that if we deliver consistent and valuable information to our customers, they ultimately will award you with their business and loyalty. Please mind it - consistent and valuable information.</span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/Content-Marketing121.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2101" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/Content-Marketing121.jpg" alt="Content-Marketing12" width="450" height="300" /></a></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="color: #000000;">Thought leaders and marketing experts from around the world, including the likes of Seth Godin and hundreds of the leading thinkers in marketing have concluded that content marketing isnt just the future, its the present.</span></p>
<p align="JUSTIFY"><span style="color: #000000;">So, in order to understand how your content marketing effort can be successful, focus on the word quality instead of what words. The following are the certain qualities which will help you understand how your content should look like:</span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Convey Benefits:</strong> While planning content use only those words which convey the benefits which can be availed by the customers rather than the features and attributes of your product/services.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Simplicity:</strong> The words you use should be simple enough to make your prospective customers understand what you are trying to say. The words should not be difficult.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Be Brief:</strong> This is the most important thing to be considered. Keep things to the minimal, so that customers like it and even remember it. Use three words instead of using four words if you can convey the right meaning in three words. The Uncola campaign by 7-Up was the best example for being brief and conveying the real meaning of their drink.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Consistency:</strong> Be consistent with your content. Dont just bombard your audience with content. Rather learn how to manage the content by sending out the right message to the right audience at right time across all your marketing channels.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Novelty:</strong> People easily get bored with the same old things so they seek novelty. That flavor of newness should be brought with time to time when you are providing information to customers. That means you need to alter in such a way, that the customers do not get confused but at the same time you convey your message.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Aspirational Words:</strong> Speak aspirationally to your customers. Use those words or convey such meaning which tells the customer the real meaning and a question arises in his mind that, Will I be better off by using this? These words are used by politicians in their speeches to get votes in their favor.</span></li>
</ul>
<span style="color: #000000;">There can be much more things that can be discussed about content marketing if we dig deep into this topic. When it comes to inbound marketing, content plays a vital role. It not only helps you produce high search engine rankings from relevant key phrases but also helps with branding and generating sales.</span>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Why to opt for MongoDB as your NoSql replacement to traditional RDBMS?</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/opt-mongodb-nosql-replacement-traditional-rdbms/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 21 Jan 2015 06:29:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2115</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2><strong>What is MongoDB?</strong></h2>
MongoDB is an open source, <strong>JSON-based, document database</strong> and leading <strong>NoSql database</strong> written in C++ to deploy highly performance oriented and scalable database. It uses custom binary (BSON) protocol.

MongoDB has a simple but powerful <strong>javascript shell</strong>, which helps in administration of MongoDB instances and data manipulation. Its current stable version is 2.6.7 released in January, 2015 with aggregation enhancements, security improvements, query-engine improvements etc.

For installation steps, refer this link - <a title="http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/installation/" href="http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/installation/" target="_blank">http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/installation/</a>

<a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/QA-Design..jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2121" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/QA-Design..jpg" alt="Q&amp;A Design." width="594" height="774" /></a>
<h2><strong>What is MongoDB good for?
</strong></h2>
<em>Show me your code and conceal your data structures, and I shallcontinue to be mystified.
Show me your data structures, and I wont usually need your code; itll be obvious. </em>

<span style="color: #339966;">Eric Raymond, the Cathedral and the Bazaar</span>

True are these words that say data structure is of paramount importance. with MongoDB, we can model the data structure more easily and expressively. Lets list some main features of MongoDB 
<ul>
	<li>MongoDB is known for its strong <strong>data consistency.</strong></li>
	<li>It retains some friendly features of SQL i.e. Queries, Indexes.</li>
	<li>It can handle multiple dynamic queries with bigger databases.</li>
	<li>Master/slave replication (auto failover with replica sets).</li>
	<li>Built-in sharding.</li>
	<li>The flexible schema of MongoDB is great forheterogeneouscollections of content types.</li>
	<li>MongoDB is capable of keeping data with complex relationships together in one object.</li>
	<li>It is easily configurable unlike other NoSql databases.</li>
	<li>Storing any type of structured log data is the future.</li>
	<li>Its key/value data representation makes it easy to use.</li>
	<li>MongoDB can store location based data. It understands geo-spatial coordinates and natively supports geo-spatial indexing.</li>
</ul>
<h2><strong>Some insights into MongoDB</strong></h2>
<strong>Document</strong>
A document is the key element in MongoDB. A document can be considered as a row in a table in traditional RDBMS. It is represented in key/value pairs i.e. an ordered set of keys with associative values. In JavaScript, for example, documents are represented as objects:

{blog : mongodb!}

Here, this simple document has single key blogwith value mongodb!
<strong>Collection</strong>
A collection can be thought of as a table with a dynamic schema. A single instance of MongoDB can host multiple independent databases, each of which can have its own collections. Every document has a special key, "_id", which is unique within a collection.
<strong>Data Manipulation</strong>
To insert data into MongoDB collection, you need to use insert() method -

&gt;db.collection.insert(document)

&gt;db.mycol.insert({
_id: ObjectId(8hju8ad8jb25),
title: 'MongoDB Blog,
description: 'Leading NoSql Database',
version : 2.6,
format : json
})

To fetch data from MongoDB collection, use find() method -

&gt;db.collection.find()

To update data, use update() method -

&gt;db.collection.update(criteria, new_data)

&gt;db.mycol.update({'title':'MongoDB Blog'},{$set:{'title':'Mongo Lab'}},{multi:true})

To delete data, use remove() method as follows -

&gt;db.collection.remove(criteria)

For more data manipulation commands, refer to this link - <a title="http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/command/" href="http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/command/" target="_blank">http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/command/</a>

<a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/mongodb_logo.png"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2122" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/mongodb_logo.png" alt="mongodb_logo" width="1440" height="852" /></a>
<h2><strong>Enterprises adopting MongoDB</strong></h2>
MongoDB has been adopted by numerous major websites and services, including Craigslist, eBay, Foursquare, SourceForge, Viacom, and the New York Times, among others as their backend.
<h2><strong>MongoDB v/s SQL Databases</strong></h2>
<ul>
	<li>Sql databases store structured data in fixed data types whereas; MongoDB can store data dynamically and dissimilar data can be stored together as required.</li>
	<li>Sql databases store data in rows in tables, MongoDB uses key/value pairs to store data in collections comprises of various documents.</li>
	<li>With MongoDB, A database administrator can simply add capacity by using various servers or cloud instances whereas; same process requires significant additional engineering for Sql databases.</li>
</ul>
If there are concurrent dynamic queries in your web application on enormous amount of data and you preferably define indexes over map/reduce functions, MongoDB is a good database to go for.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>10 Reasons How Zends Z-ray Can Be A Productivity Booster For PHP Developers</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/zrayforphpdevelopers/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 23 Jan 2015 06:07:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2124</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2128" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/zray-introduce.jpg" alt="zray introduce" width="640" height="480" />

Making new waves in the field of development, Zends new technological advancement Z-ray is proving to be quite a success with developers all over the world. It is a non-invasive productivity tool that does not require developers to change the workflow or develop new habits. Instead, it gives developers a quick and easy way to gain important insight about their code during the development process. It is essentially an information bar which shows PHP code responses in real time, enabling developers to quick study the effect of core code and code changes on the fly. Here are some compelling reasons why the Z-ray has been scoring heavily with developers 
<ul>
	<li><strong>In-depth look </strong> Z-ray allows you to take a deep, in-depth look into what your code does during the development process. Many developers have likened it to being able to look at their applications with X-ray goggles and see what is going on inside. It is an improvement on related changes Zend started to implement with version 6 of their framework, and has so far proved beneficial.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><strong>Execution Time </strong> You can now get detailed data about execution times takes by different components of requests, allowing you to understand better how the server handles the processes. Memory consumption meters are also provided.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><strong>Monitoring Events </strong> You can use the elaborate events system of Zend server in Z-ray, setting up triggers for certain events to be displayed. This way, you can instantly learn about slow response times, high memory usage, slow execution and memory errors.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><strong>Errors </strong> The dedicated errors panel displays all relevant PHP errors and warning messages generated during a particular page request. Information available includes the source and type of these errors and warnings.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><strong>Database Queries </strong> You have a detailed list of all SQL queries executed in the process of a particular page request in this section. Apart from useful information like execution time, you can also run a code back-trace to study executing further.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><strong>Functions </strong> This panel shows you a list of all PHP function calls during a particular page request. The nested view shows you crucial information regarding name, frequency of calls and time spend within the scope of a particular function.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><strong>Variables </strong> You can monitor the changes in any superglobal PHP variables in this section of the utility. You can track changes between the start and the completion of a page request.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><strong>Compatibility </strong> The Z-ray feature can be accessed from any compatible IDE as it shows information in the form of a web component that uses your browser to load.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><strong>Page Requests </strong> Z-ray provides you with an in-depth look at your page requests. Using the tool, you can view requests from your page to the server, responses, response times, paths and methods in great detail. These are useful for diagnostic purposes, and there is the option to filter out irrelevant results in case of multiple requests.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
	<li><strong>Debugging </strong> Z-ray comes in debugging efforts even when page requests do not actually originate from a browser - in case of web services and mobile use.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Content Marketing - The All-In-One Proposition For Your Business</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/content-marketing-one-proposition-business/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 28 Jan 2015 07:03:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2133</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/mohit2.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2147" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/mohit2.jpg" alt="mohit2" width="594" height="774" /></a>Content Marketing is a vital element of a business marketing mix today. Content that is targeted, relevant and timely can help create a rewarding association with readers. It not only attracts readers attention, but also helps businesses to nurture a relationship with them. This ultimately culminates to sales and new customers.

As a function, content marketing has evolved tremendously over the past few years. With the remarkable reach and coverage of Internet, it is a smart move to embrace content marketing to utilize the influence of the Internet to your benefit. And this can be done effectively through content marketing.

&nbsp;
<h3>Why content marketing for sales?</h3>
Simply put, content marketing is the strategic process of creating and distributing high value content to address of answer specific needs/ queries of the readers. It comprises of two main segments  creating content and distributing content. Be it any phase of the sales funnel  right from prospecting to closing  we have experienced that content marketing plays a vital role in each step of the way. It helps to attract visitors to your business site, keeps them engaged and eventually acquire the customer who consumes the content.
<h3>How does it boost sales?</h3>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;">1. <strong>Connect with readers and their needs</strong>  Content marketing helps acquire trust with readers by sharing information that will be of help to them. Imagine a salesman coming every day to ask you to purchase a product that may or may not have a need for. This is precisely what traditional marketing does  their in-the-face, blatant selling techniques actually repel most of the customers rather than drawing them in.</p>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;">On the other hand,</p>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;">content marketing is a more soft marketing approach, where visitors are allowed to consume the content they want and skim through others. The first half of content marketing (creating content) is what draws them in and prompts them to act. This approach puts the power in the hands of the reader/visitor, which is a very attractive proposition to engage better with them.</p>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;">2. <strong>Stand out competitively</strong>  Content is the key ingredient that lets your customers discover you before they discover your competition. It not only helps bring in traffic and positions your business as a thought leader, but also increases your brand visibility and loyalty. Content 2020, the content marketing strategy chalked out by Coca Cola is an impressive example of how brands are moving away from traditional marketing to collaborative, content-based approach.</p>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;">3. <strong>Get the customer to notice you</strong>  Great content helps prospects, customers and readers recall the value you provide. Such customer oriented experiences in turn provides a lasting brand awareness in their mind. IAB.nets research shows that 82% of B2B marketers have cited brand awareness as the top content marketing goal2 for not one, not two, but four continuous years in a row. It amply denotes the massive influence content marketing has on improving the visibility, exposure and reach of a brand.</p>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;">4. <strong>Nurturing a relationship for a win</strong>  The stage when the prospect moves from prospecting to considering to intending to finally purchasing, is a very critical juncture of the sales and marketing funnel. Content marketing helps in the smooth transition of across these different phases. With content, you can</p>

<ul style="padding-left: 30px;">
<ul style="padding-left: 30px;">
	<li>a. Keep their interest level high by making available periodic and fresh content about their needs and how it can be addressed. This ensures that the prospect feels in charge to control his/ her purchase decision.</li>
	<li>b. Gain a better engagement with them at the sensitive time of considering a purchase. This ensures that the prospect goes ahead with his/ her purchase intent and thus help close a sale.</li>
</ul>
</ul>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;">5. <strong>Makes complete business sense</strong>  As per Demand Metric, content marketing costs 62% less than traditional marketing efforts1 such as cold calling and mailers. But, it generates 3 times as many warm leads as traditional marketing. An extensive cost-benefit analysis is not required to see the enormous benefits that are achieved at a lower cost, when companies adopt content marketing in their marketing mix.
Right from not being in existence about a decade back, to seeing massive adoption in 2014, content marketing is definitely the way ahead for marketers. Keeping in mind a fresh and relevant message meant for a specific target audience, content marketing can create wonders in prospecting, engagement, acquisition and retention.</p>
We believe that marketers can utilize these content marketing pointers to influence demand signals the right way. If 73% of the B2B content marketers are producing more content3as against the previous year, due to its tremendous sway, then its high time that your marketing team too stays invested in this effective marketing tool.
<p style="padding-left: 60px;"></p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>A look at Magentos Enduring Global Success</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/look-magentos-enduring-global-success/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 04 Feb 2015 06:41:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2149</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p align="JUSTIFY">What makes Samsung, Nike, Olympus and other big names trust Magento as their preferred CMS platform? Why do almost one fourth of the e-commerce sites all over the world trust Magento for their online business? Even though many alternatives like BigComerce and Shopify have entered the development landscape, Magento still remains the perennial favorite of developers across the world. With more than 30% market share, it remains firm as one of the most loved e-commerce platforms that is adored by developers and e-commerce businesses alike for the last 7 years. Lets look at what Magento is and why it is such an overwhelming favorite.</p>

<h3 align="JUSTIFY"><b><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-2150" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Rajan.jpg" alt="Rajan" width="594" height="774" /></b></h3>
<h3 align="JUSTIFY"></h3>
<h3 align="JUSTIFY"><b>What does it comprise of?</b></h3>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Magento comes in three flavors  each suited for a particular scale and size of business.</p>

<ol>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Magento Community  This is an open source CMS that can be modified easily by other developers, thereby extending its functionality.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Magento Enterprise  This is a more premium version of the community edition that requires enterprise level security, features, configuration and functionality.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Magento Go  Unlike the other two version, the Go version offers hosting and cloud based support. This works well for smaller businesses.</p>
</li>
</ol>
&nbsp;
<h3 align="JUSTIFY"><b>Why is it such a hot favorite?</b></h3>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Magento has no rival when it comes to the sheer range of features, scores of extensions and depth of customizations possible. Though there are other worthy contenders like Shopify, the below reasons make it amply clear why Magento remains a hot favorite years after its release -</p>

<ol>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Free to install  Being Open Source, Magento is free to download and install. While the enterprise edition is paid, it is necessary considering the amazing level of security it offers against hacks and external threats</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Flexible - Once the coding commences, you can also download numerous extensions from Magento Connect marketplace. This gives you immense flexibility to improvise your source code depending on the specific client needs</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Fit for e-commerce  The system is a perfect fit for e-commerce with features like customer segmentation, superior shipping, supplier and CMS management, better tracking of cross-selling and up-selling,, and easy bundling together of products</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Hosting freedom  Other e-commerce oriented systems like Shopify need developers to use their own hosting systems. Magento unlocks this limitation and provides you freedom to use any hosting you prefer.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Scalable  With other platforms, scalability of the products range on the site is an expensive proposition. Not so with Magento. Irrespective of the number of products or SKUs to be added to the existing line, Magento allows you to do it without spending extra.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Modular  What works for a billion dollar e-commerce website might not work for a small cloth merchant. Magento provides the ability to scale up or down depending on the client business requirement thanks to its modular approach</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Speed  While most visitors will not wait more than 2 seconds for a web page to load before moving on, Magento enabled sites provide no such inconvenience. With powerful caching and ability to retrieve data from a million-record database, page loading is lightning quick</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Besides its open source nature means that at any given second thousands of developers are working simultaneously to provide a richer user experience for CMS applications developed using Magento.</p>

<h3 align="JUSTIFY"><b>When you need to look beyond Magento?</b></h3>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Now that we know where Magento revels in being a powerful e-commerce system, we also need to be aware of when this monster e-commerce ecosystem doesnt come across as a good fit </p>

<ol>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Experience  The in-house development team needs to have a good experience handling the system well. This is not for a newbie professional who wants quick results.</p>
</li>
	<li>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Freelancer  A freelancer who works between projects will be less keen to use Magento because of lack of time needed to climb the steep learning curve.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<h3 align="JUSTIFY"><b>To conclude</b></h3>
<p align="JUSTIFY">Although there are quite a few e-commerce systems available, each one has its own set of pros and cons. Developers need to take cognizance of the customers needs and budget, and then determine which system will work best. Looking at the above list of positives, you can now know easily on which projects Magento can be applied with amazing outcomes and remarkable user experience.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
