	<item>
		<title>iOS 10 : All You need to know</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/ios-10-need-know/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Jun 2016 11:07:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2641</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="wp-image-2642 aligncenter" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/ios10.png" alt="ios10" width="620" height="465" />

Consumer is the King, hence everyone around is set to make the King happy. Todays consumer wants the best of smart phones and the best of apps that help him right from waking up, to his appointments and availability, to his mails and messages, to his navigation, to his entertainment and more. Apple unveiled its biggest release ever by the name iOS 10 on June 13 in WWDC 16. iOS 10 is a power package which is Big, Bold and Beautiful and gives an experience of the future. Powers and functions of Siri have been drastically upgraded and it has become more like a mate.

<strong>Features:-</strong>
<ul>
 	<li>Lock screen redesigned with 3D Touch.</li>
 	<li>Siri is now a mate</li>
 	<li>Messages Overhauled</li>
 	<li>Photos made more cherishable</li>
 	<li>Maps Street Smarter</li>
 	<li>Calls made convenient</li>
 	<li>Apple Music made cleaner</li>
 	<li>Apple News better accessed</li>
 	<li>Home Apps control Home</li>
</ul>
<strong>Lock screen redesigned with 3D Touch</strong>

Apple has released smarter version of Lock screen with new widgets side panel, Control Center, 3D touch enabled notifications which appear broken up in bubbles. Raise to Wake feature has been introduced that lets you see all the notifications and information without the need to unlock home screen. iOS 10 instructs the users to Press Home to Unlock replacing the Slide to unlock display. On right swipe on home screen will give you a new Widgets Panel which was earlier shown in Today section of Notification Center. Left swipe takes you to the Camera for a quick click. 3D Touch enabled notifications are amazing for Messages. You can respond to imessages immediately without leaving the Lock screen. If you have doorbell camera notification, you can immediately check your visitor at front door and use intercom or even unlock the door from your phone.

<strong>Siri is now a mate</strong>

With iOS 10, Apple announced that it will open Siri to the third party developers with the introduction of Siri Kit SDK, for the first time ever. Siri being a mate, will now do ride booking, send messages, search photos apps for images and videos, place calls through apps and even help you in your workouts. Siri kits functionality has been kept limited to control the Siri experience and help it understand the language and context in a better way. Siri for iOS 10 is going to have lesser miscues, all thanks to intense API which will work in multiple languages. Siri will help you find photos or images from apps like Shutterfly or Pinterest at a command. It will also send money to your friends and family with Square, Number26 and Alipay and it will also make VoIP calls for you. Apple CarPlay has also made driving a bit safer, credit to the messaging and VoIP integration. Quicktype Keyboard is a new feature of Siri with which it will analyse your conversation with your friends and pre-fill the Calendar with the event and get it halfway done. With Quicktype feature, you can paste an address that you have recently searched for but didnt copy to your clipboard. It also helps adjust such searches in multilingual typing.

<strong>Messages Overhauled</strong>

Amongst the most used apps on iphone is imessages and hence it has grabbed a major part of concern in iOS 10. Apple has tried to make imessages a little more fun as it has introduced animated backgrounds (balloons, confetti and fireworks) and Bubble Effects to emphasise on the emotions you feel while sending text. You can make the effect to appear as Loud or bursting with a bunch of text or saying something Gentle. Another emotion of Surprise has been introduced in the form of Invisible Ink as text will remain hidden until you scroll your finger over it. Tapback is another exciting feature added to imessages which will allow you to reply to the messages in animated form of a heart or a thumbs up and much more by tapping on the bubble. Using Digital Ink will let you send messages in your own handwriting. Digital Touch, which was earlier available in Apple Watch, has now been introduced to imessages which will let you draw and sketch and incorporate it onto photos &amp; videos. Another exciting feature added to imessages is new emoji prediction to the keyboard. When you are typing the text, you will get emoji suggestions along.

Apple has announced the introduction of a dedicated App store for messages which will not only allow you to send stickers and GIFs and emojis but also allow to make payments to your friends and family.

<strong>Photos made more Cherishable</strong>

iOS 10 will help you organising photos with Advanced Computer Vision as per Apple. It stresses on the fact that photos apps ability to create albums is a result of 11 billion computations that will help it recognise Face along object and scene recognition. Siri Intelligence will help scan photo library of a user and will detect people, animals, objects and locations. In other words it will be able to trace the location of a photo overlaid on a map. Memories is another interesting feature which will cluster up photos into trips, people and topics on recognising the image, date and location so that you can relive your cherished moments once again. It will also allow you to create a movie of the photos and even customise it as per moods.

<strong>Maps Street Smarter</strong>

Apple has fixed the trouble with its Apple Maps of being unable to scroll ahead of a route. With the advanced navigation software, maps will allow zooming in and out but will also provide traffic information. iOS 10 has Maps extension for developers so the integrated apps will let you make dinner reservations or ride booking without leaving Maps app. If you go by a particular route everyday, Siri will guide give you traffic congestion status. Siri will now give suggestions to the users on trip, to find gas, food and coffee on the route. Apple Maps will mark the place where you have parked your car and it will also guide you to take routes that avoid toll roads.

<strong>Calls made Convenient</strong>

For the users who hate listening to voicemail messages, iOS 10 is coming up with a feature that will display the voicemail messages in convenient text. It will also warn the user if the incoming call is a SPAM. Whatsapp &amp; other VoIP calls will be allowed to be answered from the lockscreen itself just like any other incoming call. VoIP call list will be a part of recent and could be added in favorites list.

<strong>Apple Music made Simpler</strong>

Apple Music has been redesigned. It is now available with a simpler and cleaner design that allows cover art to stand out. It will also display the music suggestions that you may like to listen to. It also displays the lyrics of the song to add more depth to Apple Music. Search tab has been introduced which replaces Connect tab to make searching for songs quicker.

<strong>Apple News made better accessed</strong>

Apple News has also undergone changes. It will now avail For You tab which will have smaller and personalised sections. Now the must read breaking news notifications shall be displayed directly on the lock screen. Along with all this, News will be introducing Subscriptions to allow you access The Wall Street Journal or other periodicals which are otherwise paid.

<strong>Home Apps control Home</strong>

Home Apps has been made smarter with the introduction of HomeKit. Siri Intelligence will help you control all the gadgets at your home and help you to change the moods of the rooms just at a click. Swiping your finger twice to the right in Control Center will display the menu of home accessory toggles. Hard pressing on a notification bubble of a doorbell will allow you to view live camera at your front door, use intercom and even unlock the door.

Not only all this but Apple has come up with many more smaller upgrades and updates in various apps like Split view Safari on iPad, Collaboration in Notes, iCloud Drive, Voicemail Transcription, Bedtime Alarm and many more tidbits.

<strong>Date of Release</strong>

iOS 10 is made available to the developers on 13<sup>th</sup> of June and will be out for public beta testers in July. It will be available on iPhone 5 and all the later versions, iPad 4 and later versions and iPod touch 6<sup>th</sup> Generation.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Choosing Right Javascript Frameworks</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/choosing-right-javascript-frameworks/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 27 Jul 2016 12:42:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2665</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2926" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/choose-your-javascript-framework-1.png" alt="" width="1200" height="628" />

Choosing the right is what matters the most. It is a fact and remains fair for technology too. So here we are with some important insights of JavaScript frameworks to help you Choose the Right one for your project that will have huge impact on possibility to deliver on time and your ability to maintain the code in future. In this fast moving world of technology, we bring about good and pain points of these frameworks.

<strong>Why JavaScript Frameworks?</strong>

While developing a web application, sometimes we, rely on DOM manipulation library and a few utility plugins. Now the question arises that why do we use these frame works in priority? Why not stick to the traditional mode? The very brief answer to these questions is that Javascript Frameworks offer a more responsive user experience and moreover when we are stuck up in Spaghetti Code only these modern frameworks save us from this problem of disorganised projects and also help us to maintain them for long. It offers solution to the problem of code management by providing a well-defined architecture for applications that helps developers do their job easily.

<strong>When do we need JavaScript frameworks?</strong>

If you love to develop single page application, JavaScript is the perfect resort to it. Whether you want to make a complex user interface or you aim to reduce the HTTP requests. Improved responsiveness of user interface means that JavaScript framework loads a page in portions as the user interacts with them rather than making him wait to load the entire page as in traditional web application development. The MVC (Models-Views-Controllers) design pattern not only organises the code management but also makes it easy for the developers to create highly responsive user interfaces without getting lost in loops and challenges of Spaghetti Code. Java MV framework is also useful in writing those applications that communicate with an API or back end data services.

<strong>Backbone.js</strong>

This JavaScript framework was released in 2010 by Jeremy Ashkenas and is the oldest and lightweight framework to be given serious consideration. It is very versatile MVC framework that has been used in popular sites like Twitter, Pinterest, Hulu and Pandora Radio.

<strong>Benefits</strong>
<ul>
 	<li>The biggest strength of this framework is its versatility as the developers find themselves lost in an ocean of options.</li>
 	<li>It shines brightest in the hands of experienced developers.</li>
 	<li>It is lightweight, fast and has only a few simple concepts to grasp on a learning curve.</li>
 	<li>Being light and fast, it is the first choice of developers for projects where speed is a priority.</li>
 	<li>Being basic and small backbone provides you with foundation to build your dream app with innumerable options.</li>
</ul>
<strong>Pain Points</strong>
<ul>
 	<li>Backbone.js doesnt provide structure but provides basic tools to build your own structure.</li>
 	<li>Memory management needs to be taken care of due to lack of view of lifecycle management. A change in route/state may lead to memory leaks unless personally cleaned up.</li>
 	<li>It lacks two-way data binding support. In other words with a change in view you need to change the model and vice-a-versa. This enables you to write a lot of boilerplate.</li>
 	<li>In Backbone.js views manipulate the DOM directly and makes it hard for the developers to test (unit wise) and hence affects its reusability.</li>
</ul>
<strong>Angular JS</strong>

It was released in 2009 by Brat Tech LLC but came to limelight after coming under the patronage of Google. Angular is known as Model-View (MV) framework because it doesnt follow the typical MVC pattern. The top sites using Angular are VEVO, The Weather Channel and MSNBC.

<strong>Benefits</strong>
<ul>
 	<li>It has the feature of two-way data binding where the data is bound to HTML element in the view and it updates and displays the data of its own.in this framework both the model and the view are capable of updating the data.</li>
 	<li>Two-way data binding allows Angular to reduce the amount of coding requirements to create dynamic view.</li>
 	<li>Angular has a lot of built-in features and hence has less dependency on external libraries.</li>
 	<li>It has a large community and has a faster growing popularity. Being backed by Google, the core team is innovating, developing productivity and constantly growing.</li>
 	<li>It allows you to categorise your applications into building blocks like Controllers, Directive, Factories, Filters, Services and Views. Overall this structure creates the reusability of components.</li>
 	<li>Angular is created to support unit-testing.</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Pain points</b></span>
<ul>
 	<li>The two-way binding which is much loved, is criticised to the same extent. Developers find it complicating the debugging process and hindering performance.</li>
 	<li>Angular may not be quite apt for large and complex applications. It gives sluggish performance when any application calls for a complex UI.</li>
 	<li>Angular is an Expressions Language and it renders them to be very powerful. It allows developers to put logic, do calculations and perform assignments in view templates. Too much of functionality inside the templates prove hard for developers to test them in isolation.</li>
 	<li>Simple mistakes in spellings of a directive name or calling an undefined scope function which can be easily ignored, pose to be the biggest challenges to the developers leaving them scratching their heads for hours.</li>
 	<li>Digest Cycle of Angular, the caretaker of dirty checking surprises the developers. Forgetting to call $digest() while running non-Angular context or creating infinite digest loops can lead the developer to an unseen trouble.</li>
</ul>
<strong>Ember JS</strong>

Ember calls itself to be A framework for creating ambitious web application. Released in 2011 and created by Yehuda Katz, Ember is said to be reminiscent of Ruby on Rails. It is 95KB minified and compressed for production and is the quite hefty. This extra size allows you to benefit its built-in functionality. Websites using Ember are Qualcomm, NBC News, Vine and Nest.

<strong>Benefits</strong>
<ul>
 	<li>The Ember community has a general principle of convention over configuration. It has a built-in templating library, routing and thousands of other things.</li>
 	<li>Ember CLI is a very useful command line tool that handles a lot of things. It saves you from a mess of interfering with current build-up get you started with least effort.</li>
 	<li>Ember, being free of corporate patronage, has a passionate and dedicated team that focuses on open source software.</li>
 	<li>Ember has a brilliant Router and an optional data layer which is called Ember data. With innovation outset, Ember has a full-fledged data module which incorporates with Ruby-on-Rails or any other API that follows a set of convention.</li>
 	<li>Concept of The Run Loop raises the performance goal of Ember. This ensures that even if data is updated several times, only a single DOM is updated to help keep loading the application and does not hinder the speed.</li>
</ul>
<strong>Pain Points</strong>
<ul>
 	<li>The top drawback is that Embers API has changed even before it got stabilised. A lot of outdated content leads to confuse the developers who work on it for the first time.</li>
 	<li>Very similar to Angular Ember has the same concern as you need to do the things Ember Way.</li>
 	<li>A lot of built-in functionality and generated code, developers find it difficult to understand the exact situation. Being a large framework, the learning curve of developers is steep.</li>
</ul>
<strong>React</strong>

Recently released by Facebook in 2013, it is born with a different approach and hence stealing the show. Facebook says that unlike other frameworks that are client dominated MVC frameworks, React is more focussed on the View part of MVC. The Flux architecture of React makes it best suitable for larger applications. It is 120KB when minified and compressed for production. Being quite large in file size, it doesnt have external dependencies. Sites using React are Facebook, Instagram, Flipboard, BBC and Netflix.

<strong>Benefits</strong>
<ul>
 	<li>It is the fastest of all the frameworks.</li>
 	<li>React is getting popular over Angular and Ember as it is less of domain Specific language and is easy to learn.</li>
 	<li>React has a component based approach where each of it represents a part of UI. This allows mixing and matching them all and also maximizing code reusability.</li>
 	<li>React is used to create mobile application as well. Learn React once and use it for coding of both web and iOS apps.</li>
 	<li>React is a server-side supporting framework. It serves a long awaited solution to the client-side framework relating to performance and SEO problems.</li>
</ul>
<strong>Pain Points</strong>
<ul>
 	<li>React faces the most controversial aspects of its creation as it does not have any templates and uses components to generate UI.</li>
 	<li>With the component approach of React, a lot of developers seem to be uncomfortable with the fact that everything concerning a component is located in a single place.</li>
</ul>
<strong>Closing Notes</strong>

<a name="_GoBack"></a> We hope that we have successfully brought about the benefits and areas of concern of top frameworks.

Ultimately, the decision of Choosing the Right JavaScript Framework is all your personal preference in regard to the type of project you need to work on. But otherwise knowing all the pros and cons and getting a contrasting review helps making a better decision.

Framework diversity fosters innovation.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>10-step checklist for Website Redesign</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/10-step-checklist-plan-perfect-website-redesign/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 03 Aug 2016 10:00:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2687</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[&nbsp;

<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2880" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Website-Redesign.png" alt="" width="1200" height="628" />

Does this phrase Website Redesign scare you? Lets clear this fear.

Every website needs to add something new to be found by the search engine bots. Website redesign can be considered due to rebranding, shifting to a new CMS (Content Management System) or just giving your website a refresh. A redesign can either hit a huge success or trump you down badly. Website redesigning being a crucial and tedious process needs to be thoroughly planned and analysed before implementing. Here arises the need to work out a checklist that can make the whole process a lot easier and at the same time provides a safer platform to work on. Here we have jotted down some points in a series that will greatly help you if you are planning for your website a newer avatar:

1. Analyse your current Metrics
2. Determine your goals and define your audience
3. Analyse your competitors
4. Identify your Unique Value Proposition (UVP)
5. Review analytics
6. Design around buyers persona
7. Work on sitemaps &amp; create wireframes
8. Optimise your website
9. Create a Content Strategy
10. Continue with your Brand Building

<strong>Analyse your Current Metrics</strong>

Before doing anything new, start with analysing your current metrics in context with number of visitors, Bounce Rate, your SEO rankings for important keywords, Leads generated and deals matured. Use analytical tools like Google Analytics to track the site performance and get the exact picture. These figures will help you understand customer preferences and their likings. This data will further help you to decide on what to keep on your site and what to remove from it.

<strong>Determine your Goals &amp; Define your audience</strong>

It is very important to determine the goal of getting your website redesigned. It just cannot be that nothing new has been done for quite a long time or  want the website to look lavish and business to look bigger that enables you to redesign your website. You need to pin point the goals and chalk them down so that strategies and redesigning can be planned thereof. Setting measurable or quantifiable goals will help you track the level of success achieved.

After determining the goal the next important thing is to define your audience. You must be well aware of whom you want to focus on and benefit from your site. Finely defining your audience will help you understand their expectations and the kind of information they want to fetch from you.

<strong>Analyse the competitors</strong>

Analysing your competition is as important as analysing your own business. You can get enlightening ideas from your competitors and even see what does a visitor like about their site. Not only from your competitors but you can get innovative ideas from other sites as well. As visitors are attracted towards anything new to them or different from usual, put your self-analysis and your competitors analysis together and work out on improvement areas differently.

<strong>Define your Unique Value Proposition (UVP)</strong>

Defining your Value Proposition is the most basic part of a business. Before proceeding with any other content, you must first describe the value your product/service will be adding to the consumers and it should be consistently visible across your website. No one else can be equally passionate about your product or service as you are. So it is you who can chalk out the reasons of what is unique about your business? Why should your visitors buy/convert/stay on your website rather than your competitors? And even make them familiar with what you do is right for them.

<strong>Review Analytics</strong>

Reviewing analytics helps you understand and pin point the areas that had failed working. Some of the very impressive and helpful tools are Google Analytics and Google Webmasters Tools that help you find the broken lines. In turn these broken lines help you trace the pitfalls and give you an opportunity to mend them by discussing it with your developer for improvements.

<strong>Designing around Buyer Persona</strong>

Once you have identified the loopholes and defined your value proposition, its time to match them with the buyer. A buyer persona is studying your marketplace and segmenting it into group of individuals who are ideal customers or prospective buyers on the basis of demographics. To convert these prospective buyers you need to communicate them about your product/services and tell them what do you have that is best for them? your content should be talking more about your aptness and suitability to them.

<strong>Work on sitemaps &amp; create wireframes</strong>

On deciding all the pillars that will build up your website, now its time to work on sitemap. A sitemap gives details about the hierarchy &amp; structure of the site. It is a simple document explaining the flow of each page and its relation to the other one.
Creating Wireframes is the next step to chalking out sitemap. This part of building a website gives a rough layout of content &amp; structure for some unique pages like Homepage, Product pages, Blog etc.

<strong>Optimise your Website</strong>

When it comes to optimising your website you must also evaluate the performance of your site on the following areas:-

1 Is your site multi-browser
2 Is navigation simple &amp; intuitive?
3 is your site mobile responsive?
4 Are analytical tools installed and properly working?

Optimising your site means getting found online, this improves your site metrics. If no one lands on your site then there is no fun of designing it anyways. As website is your marketing mechanism online, if one comes to you them how can you increase leads, downloads or sales? For optimising your site you must go for Keyword Analysis, Link Tracking and Page Level SEO.

<strong>Create a Content Strategy</strong>

A content strategy should be an ongoing one which means that when your website has something new to offer then not only traffic to your site increases but your business also grows faster. Constant flow of fresh content should be your strategy to attract more visitors to your site over time. Some tips to be active on this strategy are:

1 Start a Blog
2 include Press releases or updates about your company.
3 Always strive to add a pinch of innovation and consider some new ideas for your visitors to enjoy.

<strong>Continue with your brand building</strong>

Your site must continue to look like an extension of your brand. Consistency is the key and everything related to your brand should maintain its brand identity.]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>57</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="category" nicename="blog"><![CDATA[Blog]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="design"><![CDATA[Design]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yst_is_cornerstone]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>

	<item>
		<title>7 things to know before hiring a Magento Development Agency</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/7-things-know-hiring-magento-development-agency/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 26 Aug 2016 10:48:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2720</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Magento is proving to be a leader of open omnichannel innovation. Merchants are feeling empowered when they find this open source, cloud-based digital commerce platform to give solutions to integrate digital and physical shopping experiences. With the rising popularity of this <a href="http://ecommerce-platforms.com/compare/best-ecommerce-platform-seo"><strong>best e-commerce platform available today</strong></a>, a lot of web development agencies have jumped into this bowl of honey. But as many of them have not have invested enough in planning and support of this platform, they fail to tame this mammoth.

<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2721" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/How-to-hire.png" alt="How to hire" width="900" height="900" />

But for merchants its important to find themselves an <strong><a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/magento-development">expert and appropriate Magento agency</a></strong> that plans, organises and supports theire-commerce store in this fast-evolving world. We are presenting to you a number of important factors that will help you choose an appropriate agency to develop your Magento e-commerce store.

1 Experience &amp; knowledge

2 Company Portfolio

3 Pre/Post Development Support

4 Communication Mechanisms

5 Security &amp; Safety

6 High end resources

7 Quality &amp; Pricing

&nbsp;

<strong>Experience &amp; Knowledge </strong>

Experience and knowledge are the most important and the foremost key factors that assure you that the developers or companies you are hiring will develop a dynamic e-commerce store for you. <strong><a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/magento-development">Experienced and knowledgeable magento developers</a></strong> or companies always have promising success stories in the form of reviews and testimonials which help you preview the quality of work done and delivered.

&nbsp;

<strong>Company Portfolio</strong>

After experience its time to check expertise and professionalism of the development company. Portfolio speaks a lot about the developers or the agency in context of the working style, a resourceful team and above all it tells the methodology and process used. These unsaid features further indicate the truth of success story of the company in the form of commitment to the clients and number of projects worked and delivered and so on.

&nbsp;

<strong>Pre/Post Development Support</strong>

Developing an e-commerce store in Magento is not a one-time process. It needs to be regularly monitored and updated from time to time. <strong>Post development support</strong> ensures that bugs and other related issues are solved even before your e-commerce store goes live. Some of the very basic reasons as to why post development support is required are:-
a) Better performance of the e-commerce store.
<ol>
 	<li>b) Addition and updating of new features and functions with the changing requirements.</li>
 	<li>c) Efficiency and convenience in operations.</li>
 	<li>d) Customization and integration of third party.</li>
</ol>
&nbsp;

<strong>Communication Mechanism</strong>

Before you zero-in on any developer or company on the basis of their Portfolio, Experience and support the next important factor that needs serious consideration is the communication mechanism. The developer should have superior communication skills which mean that he should have prompt understanding of the requirements of the client. There should be an easy<strong> flow of communication</strong> which is possible with strong intrapersonal skills on the part of the developer, lingual efficiency between the client and the developer and most importantly the company should possess <strong>essential communication tools</strong>. Tools like Skype and Google talk lets you interact with the other party regarding the development of e-commerce store and let the work flow efficiently and supports the team in case of development of offshore projects.

&nbsp;

<strong>Safety &amp; Security</strong>

Cyber criminals are getting attracted by the numerous benefits and unending profits of e-commerce stores. They are always there peeping around to find loopholes to crack the code and attack your website. So just like taking <strong><a href="https://magento.com/security">effective security measures</a></strong> for your office and home, same way hire an agency which is well-versed with all the safety guidelines and takes security as a priority. Magento keeps updating itself on security fronts regularly, so should the developer keep implementing those updates and possess that cutting edge knowledge to develop a secured e-commerce store.

&nbsp;

<strong>High End Resources</strong>

High end resources means that the company you desire to hire should have sufficient number of Developers &amp; Designers, a constant high speed internet connection available round the clock and power back up and an uninterrupted medium of communication. All these points of high end resources add up to the productivity of the team and efficiency in the development of the project.

&nbsp;

<strong>Quality &amp; Pricing</strong>

Once you are satisfied with all the factors mentioned above, its time to finalise on pricing. If you ever feel that a company is charging you a little higher then you should first compare the <a href="http://techiesindiainc.com/our-work"><strong>quality of work delivered</strong></a> as cost will be repaid to you by the operations of the e-commerce store but quality of Magento Developed website should never be overlooked. Paying a little extra amount for a cutting edge online business solution in this competitive social environment is not a bad deal at all.

&nbsp;

<strong>Conclusion</strong>

Creating a Magento e-commerce solution is not an easy job but a task that involves an in-depth technical expertise and support. So if you want that your e-commerce store should give high quality shopping experience to your customers and heavy ROI to you then you must consider all the factors mentioned above and choose your Magento Development Agency wisely.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>6 ways to effectively optimise your sales strategy</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/improve-digital-agency-sales/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 06 Sep 2016 07:06:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2726</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="size-full wp-image-2727 aligncenter" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/optimize-sales-.png" alt="optimize sales" width="822" height="462" />

Are you lost in todays world of fast and rapidly changing digital marketing Landscape? Marketing world has witnessed a drastic change in its scope. The horizons have widened to E-commerce stores, Content Marketing, Search-Engine Optimisation and so on. But whole of this progress and expansion revolves around one important factor- <strong>The Consumer</strong>. Attracting prospects to your brand and generating strong pipeline of quality leads are the biggest challenges for a digital agency. Conversion of visitors into prospects and prospects into a qualified opportunity is the aim of every business concern. For a digital agency to increase its profits, we bring about a few factors to improve on.
<ol>
 	<li>Define a clear Value Proposition.</li>
 	<li>Improve utilization rate.</li>
 	<li>Inculcate a habit to use Project Management Tools</li>
 	<li>Create relevant content</li>
 	<li>Optimize website Design</li>
 	<li>Innovate</li>
</ol>
&nbsp;

<strong>Define a clear Value Proposition:</strong>

Value proposition is one of the most important and useful marketing statement by means of which a company summarizes as to why a customer should use its products or services. With a strong value proposition, customer is concisely communicated about the relevance of the solution offered by the company he was seeking. When a customer finds a strong value and an honest appeal of quality service that is related to his needs/desires, he would surely turn up to you.

&nbsp;

<strong>Improve Utilization Rate:</strong>

For a digital agency, its biggest financial investment is its team. People working for you are the most valuable assets. Optimum utilization of your team members (in terms of billable hours) adds up to the productivity and efficiency of your organization as a whole. So to be proficiently managed and profitably run, utilization rate must be improved on. Though providing after sales services is also important but to an extent that it doesnt hinder your current or upcoming projects. So improving your utilization rate will let you focus on prospective business thereby enhancing the conversion rate of the leads into sales.

&nbsp;

<strong>Inculcate a habit of using Project Management tools</strong>

With the latest tools and updating softwares, Sales has become more of a science than a magic. CRM softwares offer free downloads and lets you organize, track and grow your sales pipeline. For example Hubspot CRM offers its users the tools that adapts to their process, automates the tedious tasks and connects to the ones that are already using conveniently. It also makes tracking the interactions with your customers available at a glance and frees your entire team from reporting that often hence letting them focus more on sales. It helps your Marketing and Sales platforms to integrate their efforts, hand off qualified leads, manage them with personalized approach and close the deals.

<strong>Create relevant content</strong>

Creating relevant content means to go for content that adds value, information, relevance and engages prospect consumers. A piece of content that helps them solve their pains and addresses their concerns is what prospects are seeking. When a prospect finds the content that caters to his hunger for information and learning he would surely return to you. A crisp and unique content is the key to unlock the doors to reach out to potential consumers and win them all for your sales funnel.

&nbsp;

<strong>Optimise Website Design</strong>

A qualified lead can be generated only by creating an interest about your service and product in your target audience. Website design is actually a brands in-build lead generation channel. So your website makes your first impression on the prospect consumer and a clearly visible and strong value proposition helps win you a prospect consumer. For a quality lead generation, your website design must consider inbound marketing techniques throughout the design and development process. A good website design and layout help generation of qualified leads and an impressed visitor becomes your assured customer without any additional investment.

&nbsp;

<strong>Innovate </strong>

Thinking out-of-the-box or innovating the routine processes acts as a magic wand. Using Analytics tools to find insights about prospect leads, engaging at the right time helps in closing the leads faster with quicker responses. Analysing the data on email recipients, time spent by leads on reviewing offers and actively interested people will definitely help improve your sales process. Some more tips on adding innovation to qualified lead generation are to strengthen your blog, diversifying content for your readers, using Webinars to connect to your prospects, provide free tools to your visitors and educate them feed their quest for knowledge. These are some of the expert tested tips that surely work to raise the sales for your agency.

&nbsp;

<strong>Conclusion</strong>

Since every company and project is unique, you can run a number of described strategies and even mix and match them to make a perfect combination that works well in qualified lead generation. You need to work on the right time to connect to the most engaged prospect. A good database helps you in progression to reach to final sale and stay informed for future references.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>7 Reasons Why Your Business Needs a Mobile App</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/7-reasons-business-needs-mobile-app/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 27 Sep 2016 11:44:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2749</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class=" wp-image-2750 aligncenter" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/why-need-mobile-app.jpg" alt="why-need-mobile-app" width="669" height="669" />

&nbsp;

Do you think that mobile apps are just about matching candies or sharing pictures of your cats or catch a PokeMon?

&nbsp;

Well.. You need to reconsider your thoughts.

&nbsp;

None of us can deny the fact that in this era of smartphones and tablets have given todays businesses a new approach and opportunity to reach your target audience at the click of a button.

&nbsp;

With the exponential growth of smartphone &amp; tablet users, mobile apps have become an integral part of the businesses just like websites are indispensable for every business entity.

&nbsp;

According to recent IDC research report, nearly 80% of smartphone users spend 22 hours on phones and further on 80% of this time is spent using apps. So if you want to win your customers, you need to be in their reach anytime and anywhere.

&nbsp;

Still thinking on how will the increase in smartphone users contribute to your customer base? Here we bring 7 reasons to help you know the importance of mobile apps for your business.

&nbsp;
<ol>
<ol>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 25px;"><strong><u>Need of Customer.</u></strong> Todays tech savvy customers are so accustomed to using apps that they use it for everything. From listening to music, to shopping online, to getting coupons, to connecting to the brands they love and much more customers use their mobiles and tablets almost for everything. Smartphones are getting smarter every day and business owners around the world are tapping into this smartness by getting mobile apps developed for their brands. So to attract more customers, make sure you too have one representing your brand in their devices.</li>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 25px;"><strong><u>Added channel for business.</u></strong> One of the biggest advantages of having a mobile app is the opportunity to inform your customers. It can be about anything you want including special offers or promotions, or introduction of a new product line at their fingertips. With the growing trend of mobile apps, customer prefers to use e-commerce channels as they are quick and offer wider range. Your mobile app helps your business in this direction and making it capable to understand your customers better.</li>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 25px;"><strong><u>Build Brand and its Recognition. </u></strong>Success of your business critically depends on your brand and without an app your brand might appear distanced from latest technology trends. A mobile app is actually like a blank bill board, to which you can add features and designs that your customers will love and get attracted to. A mobile app is a natural extension of your company and a great opportunity to showcase your products and services. Having a beautiful mobile app designed for your business helps your brand by enhancing customer experience and foster brand recognition and your customer relationship.</li>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 25px;"><strong><u>Direct connect with your customers. </u></strong>With a mobile app, you have the power to directly connect with your customers. Unlike other social media networks, who decide as to whom to show your posts, you can provide them general info, prices, booking forms, search features, messengers and much more. Through push notification you can get even in closer interaction and remind your customers about your products &amp; services or any special event or announcements.</li>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 25px;"><strong><u>Improved customer Engagement. </u></strong>For a better customer experience and improved customer engagement, it is always advised to have a mobile app with messaging service. When you have a mobile app for your business, your customer just needs a way to reach to you. Having a Helpdesk or a messaging feature within your app will make it lot more convenient to the customer and can really make a difference in the way you communicate with them.</li>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 25px;"><strong><u>Edge over competition.</u></strong>Customer is the King for any business. Plead you King with something your competitors dont offer. Make your presence felt and be where your target audience is. A mobile app takes you far above your local competition and makes your business location independent. You can drive more action out of your customers by sending those alerts about the latest deals and discounts that they can avail at their nearest stores. Mobile apps allow you to keep in regular touch with your customers anytime and anywhere.</li>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 25px;"><strong><u>Better Customer Loyalty. </u></strong>Customer loyalty is the most important reason for your business which ensures that same customer returns to you time and again. With all that noise around- in form of billboards, newspaper ads, T.V. ads, Facebook ads, websites, website banners etc. the final impact on customers is lost somehow. Only an app can help you to make a genuine and sincere approach to your customer of your product/service. Offer your app users exclusive discounts, content or direct access to your business which keeps them engaged and feel important. A more favourable behaviour is expected out of customers when they know that you are just a tap away and this cultivates loyalty towards your brand.</li>
</ol>
</ol>

With all these benefits of having a mobile app, we feel that you would be convinced to have one for your own business. Mobile app will soon be an essential component of every business, as this is the age of smartphones and smart customers. Get an app developed for your brand and harness a better user experience and improved sales graph.
<h3 style="text-align: center;"></h3>
<h3 style="text-align: center;"></h3>
<h3 style="text-align: center;">If you still could not make up your mind, Let us help you decide. For free consultation add us on Skype: <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><em><span style="color: #3366ff; text-decoration: underline;">ig.techies</span></em></span></h3>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Things you don&#039;t know about Google&#039;s Allo</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/things-dont-know-googles-allo/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 13 Oct 2016 07:09:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2765</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<center><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VXEkoXgb4bI" width="750" height="350" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></center>With all instant messaging mobile apps like Facebook Messenger, Whatsapp and iMessages how can Google be left behind? Google launched its new chat app for Android and iPhone on 21<sup>st</sup> Sept 2016. Google describes Allo as a smart messaging app with Artificial Intelligence (AI) that helps say more, express better and do more. Allo includes an in-app assistant called @google that will help you make plans with friends &amp; family, find information instantly, play videos, offer restaurant suggestions and express yourself in better way.

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Whats new in Allo?</b></span>

Allo is an app which draws on Googles machine learning software to learn how users chat, in order to generate and suggest appropriate responses quickly. The Artificial Intelligence (AI) also underpins the virtual assistant while offering responses, to provide directions, weather news and flight information.

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Stand aparts for Allo are:</b></span>
<ol>
 	<li><b>The Google Assistant.</b> @google is the best feature topping the charts for Allo. This virtual assistant pulls information from the internet within a chat without pausing it for a while. Google says that the Assistant that is now available in allo is a preview of advanced AI virtual assistant that can answer your queries and provide appropriate information within messages.</li>
 	<li><b>Automatic responses.</b> To save on users time when they are o the move, Allo suggests automatic replies. Though initially the conversation may appear to be bland, but as this software empowers the machine to pick up each users style of conversation and use it when required.</li>
</ol>
Google says whether youre a haha or lol kind of a person, smart reply will improve over time and adjust to your style of conversation.
<ol start="3">
 	<li><b>Image recognition</b>. Allo has another outstanding feature of recognising the image that lets it differentiate between an animal and a human or recognise what the image is all about. It also suggests responses and expressions similar to that of humans.</li>
 	<li><b>Varied size texts and images.</b> Allo contains playful features similar to that of Apples iMessages, Facebooks messenger and has the ability to scribble on pictures, vary size of text messages and send stickers.</li>
 	<li><b>Chat in incognito mode.</b> Google Allo takes privacy and security to the next level beyond Transport Layer Security (TLS) called Incognito. With Incognito mode, messages have an additional feature for privacy like discrete notification &amp; message expiration.</li>
</ol>
In contrast to all the above said goodies the real picture of Google Allo is way different from the one projected. After 2 weeks of release the goods, we bring the goods (aforesaid) and the ills of Allo.

<b>Google Assistant is not a Hit</b>. With the incorporation Google Assistant, the company has tried to stand above the pack of regular chat apps but actually falls apart. Google assistant provides you suggested responses to the person you are chatting to, on the basis of information gathered. It suggests the text even before you type anything. These are helpful to some extent but are also annoying at times when it responds in unusual manner. As far as the feature of offering list of references on restaurants is talked about, assistant highlights the suggestions on its own which actually might not match your taste. And for movies, it might give you the list of latest releases but cant get reservations done for you. Theres no way to turn off assistant while chatting.

<b>User Privacy put on stake</b>. Privacy perspective has been compromised a lot. To improve the responses of its Artificial Intelligence, Google has made a default setting wherein it monitors and records everything of your conversation and keep it indefinitely unless intentionally deleted by the user. But it has put the users privacy at stake as the records may be hacked by hackers.

<b>Restricted availability.</b> Allo is an app that is used only on phones and is not available for chatting on computers, laptops or tablets. It is restricted to the contacts that are already using this app and none others.Moreover it doesnt have a supporting video calling feature in it. Though Google has launched a separate app for calling named Duo, but there is no link between the both.

<b>Adoption Barrier.</b> The main barrier to adoption might be the number of people who actually download this app. imessages being the direct competition are inbuilt in iPhones and hence have an advantage and even offer better and more amusing features than Allo. More than one billion people each are already using Facebook messenger and Whatsapp. Its a tough fight for Allo to prove its worth.

Concluding in the words of Tony Wright, a strategist at DigitasLBi, Google loves to integrate its products into one another, so there will be some sort of search PPC equivalent within app products at some point perhaps.

Concluding the Blog, we would just say that with Allo Google has introduced a smart Assistant who is qualified enough but lacks experience. So the decision is all yours, whether you like a quick-witted assistant or simply ignore it.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>7 Reasons your eCommerce store needs to be switched onto Magento</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/7-reasons-ecommerce-store-magento/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 26 Oct 2016 09:51:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2780</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2781" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/7reasons-to-choose-Magento.png" alt="7reasons-to-choose-magento" width="1024" height="687" />

With the continuous growth of sales in online business, nearly every industry is adding online sales and e-commerce as a part of their marketing strategy. The success of online business can be witnessed from the fact that many online retailers are a big hit even without having any physical stores. Big names like ebay, Amazon and Flipkart are no exceptions. If you are planning to add ecommerce to your marketing strategy or you already have an e-store on an unsuitable platform then give it a thought again. With the advancement in technology even the hackers have grown scarier. As we are in shark-infested water confidentiality, integrity and availability forms pillars of basic criterion to select right platform.

Magento offers solution to all these troubles. Being the most flexible and secure e-commerce platform that really features a framework system and gives you liberty to select and shape your store as per your own needs. With Magento you can build custom solutions that leverage amazing and eye-catching designs that are user friendly and also empowers thousands of retailers and brands with the framework to rapidly innovate and grow. It has become preferred choice of millions of retailers and store owners due to following reasons:
<ol>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 15px;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><b><u>Customisable open sourced software.</u></b></span> Magento is the worlds leading ecommerce platform and is the fastest growing open source software available in the marketplace. Being open source, it allows the store owners and programmers to access the store owners and programmers to access the source code. It permits the developers to utilise various functionalities as per the requirement of the store. It also reduces the cost and saves money as it is a free to download ecommerce platform.</li>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 15px;"><b><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Offers Scalability</span></b>Magento is platform that offers high scalability which means that it fulfils all types of   business requirements when backed with right configuration and hardware. In others words, scalability means with sudden increase in traffic on a Magento store, the performance will not be hampered in terms of slow page load speed or website crashing. Fortunately Magento is the perfect solution to such a business condition offering scalability and thus ensures that the store continues to grow and function well at every phase.</li>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 15px;"><u><b>SEO Friendly</b></u><span style="font-size: medium;">.</span> The key to a successful e-commerce site is that your customers are able to find your products &amp; services easily on the major search engines like Google or Bing. Magento takes care of all the SEO requirements of your ecommerce store by offering diverse search engine optimised features. It creates tags, descriptions with keywords, sitemaps and URL options. Magento is available with Google sitemap which opportune your developers to inculcate search engines about products and services of your online store.</li>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 15px;"><u><b>Supportive Community.</b></u> Magento being the fastest growing platform has a rapidly growing community too that supports and offers solutions to all technical &amp; programing queries. This community includes users, store owners, developers and even service providers who very supportively lend a helping hand when it comes to support system and resources for Magento users. Working with Magento as an e-commerce platform has an advantage of being perfect time saver in overcoming and fixing issues.</li>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 15px;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><u><b>Advanced catalogue Management.</b></u></span> Magento has the most advanced product upload features. It facilitates you to add thousands of products to your catalogue at a single import. Along with this it also includes feature of managing your catalogue with multiple categories &amp; dynamic product attributes. With the most advanced capabilities and features, Magento provides comparisons, wish lists, search results &amp; related products blocks like a breeze.</li>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 15px;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><u><b>Most Secure Platform</b></u></span><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>. </b></span>In this environment, where hackers keep trying to crack databases every off and then, security is not an option. Same way data breaches are amongst every day news in case of e-commerce store. Fortunately Magento is always under constant watch by experts (or ethical hackers) who keep looking for the loopholes and on finding some, eliminate vulnerability by fixing the patches. With an amazingly dedicated community which reveals the errors and makes safety updates, Magento is close to being a perfect system.</li>
 	<li style="padding-bottom: 15px;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><u><b>Numerous Extensions &amp; Themes.</b></u></span><b> </b>Magento offers a wide collection of extensions &amp; functionalities. Magento Connect &amp; Magento Marketplace are the superstores of Themes &amp; Extensions for Magento 1.9.x and Magento 2 respectively. Users are offered with a high chance of freedom and extreme flexibility to optimise their stores and make it sturdier. Some of the most popular Magento extensions are shopping Cart, one page checkout and many others. It also has extensions for anything from SEO and blogging to image handling and affiliate marketing. Every extension has its ratings and reviews that enable the user to decide whether to install or purchase one.</li>
</ol>
<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Conclusion</b></span>

Magento helps you to create a socially engaging experience with the use of latest technology to intensify your brand. It not only secures you from online perils but also offers numerous features and functionalities that beautifies your store and simplifies your life.

If you have made up your mind to get your ecommerce store designed or upgrade an existing one to Magento, talk to us. We are a team of Magento experts who will turn your imagination into reality with Magentos technological advancements.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Why online reviews can affect your customers behaviour?</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/online-reviews-can-affect-customers-behaviour/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 29 Nov 2016 12:12:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2808</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2809" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/encourage-online-reviews.jpg" alt="encourage-online-reviews" width="1000" height="560" />

Don't you pay attention to your online reviews? Well... How would you react if you get to know that 90% of online buyers are influenced by online reviews before making a buying decision?

Bingo... We've got you there!

As per a survey conducted on respondents, <strong>88% of internet users trust online reviews</strong> as personal recommendations. That is why when you need to increase your online sales and attract more customers, you must contemplate upon having more reviews.

In other words,<em> "<strong>having no reviews is no less harmful than having negative reviews"</strong></em><strong>.</strong>

Another reason for increasing significance of these reviews is that with the increase in e-commerce business online buyers feel better to be armed with some information rather than none.

Moreover for an effective local SEO, <strong>online reviews top the priority charts</strong>. Local search engines are in a business to provide people with accurate information for their search queries. And according to MOZs Local SEO Ranking Factors Survey, 10% of the results presented by Google and other search engines are based on online reviews. So focus on your ecommerce store this way as well.

<b>Ways to garner Positive reviews:-</b>
<ol>
 	<li><u><b>Have a Website.</b></u> No doubt it is elementary these days to have a website. But just having a website doesnt serve the purpose. Your website must be well equipped with following:-</li>
</ol>
<ul>
 	<li>Information about your business. It should provide clear contact information like your business address, working hours, site directions and a map.</li>
 	<li>Complete updates. It should be completely updated with whole range of products and services available and their respective prices.</li>
 	<li>Should promote your business positively.</li>
</ul>
<ol start="2">
 	<li><u><b>Ensure it to be mobile friendly.</b></u> With the increasing trend of smartphones and other mobile devices, it has become essential to have a website that is mobile friendly. As per a survey 60% of internet users contact a local business when its website is mobile friendly.</li>
</ol>
<ol start="3">
 	<li><u><b>Observe and respond aptly.</b></u> You should keep a check on the reviews. In other words observe the negative reviews, dont apologize immediately but offer a resolution to the customer offline. Your negative customers once convinced, often turn out to be more loyal ones. Same way you should take out time to thank positive reviewers and appreciate them for their valuable time.</li>
</ol>
<ol start="4">
 	<li><u><b>Dont purchase fake reviews.</b></u> Sooner or later fake reviews get exposed and badly damage your reputation. Once the tag of fake gets attached to your business, it will be really hard to revive and rebuild it.</li>
</ol>
<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Conclusion</b></span>

All the above mentioned points clearly establish a direct relationship between online reviews and increase in volume of sales. Being an ecommerce seller, inspite of limitations of online feedback system, its well worth to get your buyers post something about your products and services. The quality of your products and services will itself speak volumes by way of positive reviews, higher rankings and greater revenues. So work quickly on converting your unhappy reviewers to be happy customers again and appreciate and thank your positive reviewers for better customer satisfaction.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>What is Google AMP and How Does it Affect SEO?</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/google-amp-affect-seo/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 13 Dec 2016 12:46:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2820</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="size-full wp-image-2824 aligncenter" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/tuesday-tips-1.png" alt="tuesday-tips-1" width="800" height="600" />

<b>What is AMP?</b>

Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) is Googles initiative to eliminate lethargic mobile site performance with emblazing speed. Google launched AMP with a motive to show FAST search engine result pages to the users. It intended to optimise the experience of mobile browsing while the user is on-the-go and doesnt have fast speed internet. By standardising a mobile version with AMP, Google will let the publishers use this open source coding so that their sites get quickly loaded on mobiles and provide a better user experience.

<b>Why is AMP Important?</b>

Can you afford to lose 40% of your potential users? How? As per search results 40% of traffic aborts the session if the site takes more than 3 seconds to load. This is spine-chilling, but its a fact. Today's users are becoming more demanding and eager. Its not a hitch but an opportunity for developers to offer great user experience. Google, in past October, announced the introduction of a very accessible framework which would create fast mobile webpages. This framework is called Accelerated Mobile Pages (or AMP in short) and is known to have acquired importance amongst the ranking factors.

&nbsp;

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>How is AMP lightning fast?</b></span>
<ol>
 	<li><b>AMP is just like Diet HTML.</b> With a moto to increase the speed, certain HTML tags and things like forms have been eliminated.</li>
 	<li><b>Optimised CSS</b>. Optimised and streamlined version of CSS has been made obligatory.</li>
 	<li><b>Third party Java script is prohibited</b>. AMP manages resource handling and asynchronous loading. So the basic idea behind is that whole of this platform has been established to encourage readability and speed.</li>
</ol>
<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Beneficiaries.</b></span>

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Publishers/Content Marketers</b></span>
<ul>
 	<li><b>Listed among Top Stories.</b> Implementation of AMP will place those pages in the Top Stories of search results and organic listings. Highlighted with grey lightning bolts, AMP pages could be easily recognized.</li>
 	<li><b>Satisfied users. </b>With faster loading, there would be dropped bounce back rate, raised traffic and pageviews and ultimately higher conversion.</li>
 	<li><b>Impressive Results of AMP ads. </b>With quicker loading, users will consume more content and visit other pages on the site. This will lead to increased revenue for the monetised websites.</li>
 	<li><b>Potential increase in search rankings. AMP</b> is quite apt and eligible criteria to increase your search rankings as Google has clearly declared direct correlation between AMP and top search results.</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Users </b></span>
<ul>
 	<li><b>Instant results.</b> Users get disappointed when they have to wait for excessive time for the page to get loaded, but with this framework they will get their search results almost instantly.</li>
 	<li><span style="font-size: medium;"><b>No pop-ups</b></span>. Preventing<b> </b>third party JavaScript has helped users to view their desired pages without getting irritating pop-ups time and again.</li>
</ul>
<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Early Adapters of AMP</b></span>

AMP was initiated by Google and Twitter and hence they were among the firsts to adapt it. Google Amp is rapidly getting adopted by big news sites like CNN and The New York Times. Ecommerce Company like eBay also gets enlisted among the AMP sites.

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Conclusion</b></span>

We expect that by reading this blog you would have gained the understanding on the concept of AMP and how it is important. AMP is really powerful and is being favoured by Google, so it has the potential to dominate the mobile search. Google is promoting this initiative just to provide its users with a better experience and fast content loading. Google AMP is in its initial stages. But we hope that Google will soon add functionalities and simplify some integration aspects for a quicker acceptance by the publishers.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>49</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>

	<item>
		<title>Magento Vs WooCommerce Which Is The Best Fit For For Your e-store ?</title>
		<link>http://dreamhtml.com/techies-new/magento-vs-woocommerce-best-fit-e-store-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 20 Dec 2016 13:14:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[webmaster]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://techiesindiainc.com/?p=2829</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2827" src="http://techiesindiainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/woocommerce-vs-magento.jpg" alt="woocommerce-vs-magento" width="1200" height="628" />

Today we present to you, a very interesting and knowledgeable competition amongst two of the most popular ecommerce platforms namely Magento and WooCommerce. Both of them have their own advantages that put them on the priority list of storeowners for a choice to host their ecommerce web stores.

There has been a constant increase in number of online businesses which aim to grab the greatest share of their audience and maximise their profit potentials. To raise ours readers and future storeowners from dubiety for selection of right ecommerce system, we bring to you a detailed analysis of similarities and their respective differences.

<style type="text/css">
	<!--
		@page { margin: 2cm }
		P { margin-bottom: 0.21cm }
	-->
	</style>

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Similarities:-</b></span>

<strong><span style="font-size: large;">Open Source</span></strong>

Both these platforms are open source products. In other words, open source means that their original codes are freely available and anyone can build his own product on that base structure code. Being open source serves as biggest advantage to both these leaders as they have large communities and a beginner gets abundance of help from them.

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Cost-effective</b></span>

Another similarity shared by both these systems is that they are available free of cost. It means that there is no cost of purchase of the basic code and there are no hidden costs or even no on-going subscription charges. This helps in keeping the project costs low and develop your eCommerce store without raised invoices.

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Secure &amp; Flexible</b></span>

As Magento and WooCommerce jointly power 40% of all eCommerce websites, both of them have powerful eCommerce features. With an excellent community support system they offer outstanding security and robust outlay with advanced security checks.

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Comparisons</b></span>

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Basics</b></span>

Magento is an open source project like Word Press, but it is designed as a perfect eCommerce solution.

WooCommerce is still seen as a relatively newcomer due to its appearance in 2011. It is a plug-in to Word Press which turns a WordPress site into a functioning store.

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Usability</b></span>

Magento is a standalone and dedicated eCommerce platform. With a huge array of features and eCommerce functionalities it can power anything from small shops to huge multinationals. Magento is not only easy to use but also easy to learn and understand. Due to a large community of supporters grown around, it assists beginners to construct on their online spaces but also guide them to avoid mistakes.

WooCommerce on the other hand is an add-on to the content management system Word Press. It tends to work nicely on a range of WordPress extensions. It is designed for SMEs and can support only small websites.

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Design &amp; Features</b></span>

As far as shopping cart facility, uploading infinite products and further categorising is concerned both Magento and WooCommerce perform equals. But when it comes to further customisation of your store and provisions of facilities like cross-sell comes forth, Magento wins with a clear distinction.

Magento not only offers up-selling, it also lets you compare products, add special deals and coupons, work with different currencies &amp; offer payment options. Magento has capability to run multiple storefronts via one dashboard which adds scalability to its features.

WooCommerce is a well-developed plugin renowned for its intuitive use and easy launching. It has clean and sleek default design with a range of customisation options. It comes with a limited number of features, so needs to buy additional plugins to unlock its full potential.

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Cost</b></span>

Initially both Magento and WooCommerce are available free of cost. But Magento has more features as standard. As the business grows, storeowners will need to add extensions for a customised store of developing business.

WooCommerce comparatively has limited options. The basic version allows payment via PayPal and bank transfers only and for full range of payment options you need to buy extensions.

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Applicability</b></span>

Magento is used by various international brands like Nike, Samsung and Olympus. As an eCommerce powerhouse Magento takes a bit of effort to climb the steep learning curve, but it really repays many times over. Being a very powerful platform, it has multi-store management function.

WooCommerce on the comparative side is more popular amongst small web stores. Due to its foundation on WordPress, it puts much emphasis on intuitive design, navigation &amp; functionality. It has similar interface to WordPress and has limited functionality.

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Conclusion</b></span>

After providing the relevant areas of equals and contrasts, we conclude in the words that your decision to choose from these two platforms might be dependent on factors like: Who are your target group? What kind of store you have in your mind? How many products do you offer? Do you want a fully customized store in terms of design and functionality? etc. To help you make a better choice some important points of both in short are:

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>Magento Offers</b></span>

Magento has been most powerful, self-hosted and a fully dedicated solution to eCommerce. With a plethora of features, functionalities and options, it is very fast when feuled with appropriate infrastructure. It has a seamless capability to manage more than one store simultaneously and has out of the box functionality of being effortlessly optimising for search engines. For international eCommerce Magento can be conveniently localized in terms of currency settings. Being a powerhouse performer, Magento is a bit complex and takes time to exploit its fullest potential.

<span style="font-size: large;"><b>WooCommerce Offers</b></span>

WooCommerce has contrasting features to Magento in terms of ease to handle. Its scope is narrower and functionality limited. It is an option that suits beginners, niche marketers and testers who have small range of products to sell. Hence it is suitable for smaller e-stores only.]]></content:encoded>
